Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel if you don't mind navigating serious traffic!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelJunkie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Palomar gets an A+ for design and service but, rates a B- for location for me. Crossing Mockingbird Lane to get to shopping at Mockingbird Station or the light rail station or SMU campus is just plain dangerous. We are savvy travelers who regularly navigate NYC and other busy cities but, found Dallas traffic at this corner location significant. We were so thankful for the courtesy hotel car and used it to drop us at SMU and Northpark Mall. Also, request a pool view room as these are the most quiet. Rooms facing Mockingbird Station are the noisiest. Fantastic service and hotel design with a very nice small pool area and evening outdoor fire pit seating area. Kimpton members are treated well and we appreciated the late check out. Disliked the location...we were always aware of the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite”
Reviews.Author: Danicamc
Reviews.Content: Recently my mother and sister and I met up for a long weekend in Dallas. We usually choose NYC or las Vegas, but after a lot of debate, we decided to give Dallas a try. We could NOT have been happier with our choice to stay at the Palomar. From the moment we arrived until the day we left, the Palomar "family" made our stay perfect. The front desk (especially Tim) was incredibly helpful and on point about shopping and dining. There was a courteous car always ready to take us to great shopping nearby, and the wine and snacks hour was a nice touch. Our suite was ample, and when our Kuerig didn't work in our room, not only did they replace it, they sent up a complimentary pot of fresh coffee and cream for the inconvenience. The hostess, Ally, at the restaurant was a delight, and breakfast and dinner were amazing! No need to venture anywhere else with such an adventurous and menu downstairs (kudos to using local farms and businesses in your menu) With a spa next door with core fusion classes (was sore for a good 3 days:), a wonderful, unpretentious staff, and it's proximity, we will DEFINITELY be making this a yearly trip!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Gabsgalleg
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Nice and clean, the location is perfect, beds and pillows are relly good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amanda J
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with all the expected elegant Kimpton touches. Very pleased with the outdoor pool and jacuzzi on the 2nd floor. Quiet in the evening with live music it is the perfect place to unwind after a long day. The fitness center was also very nice. Only negative is that coffee is served downstairs instead of providing it in the room. Long wait for those of us who need our caffiene in the morning but don't want to go through the hotel until after our morning routines. Overall great stay and very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel. Next to SMU.”
Reviews.Author: EnchantedOne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while our son toured SMU next door. Beautiful rooms and hotel ambiance. Great room service. Concierge was so kind to allow us late check out for late flight back home. The only drawback is the erratic hotel van/taxi service picking up at SMU to bring back (if you don't rent a car you'll need) and the breakfast service was incredibly SLOWWW, esp. for people trying to make appointments.

Reviews.Title: “Always great”
Reviews.Author: okc5262
Reviews.Content: I usually stay here when I come to Dallas, which is quite often. The rooms are always clean, super comfy, & it's in a great location. The staff is very accommodating and friendly, particularly the valet guys. The restaurant has great food. Love their short ribs and rissotto. I love coming back to this hotel after a long day. They have good coffee & tea in the lobby in the morning. (Plus, they are attentive & keep it filled.) They also helped me out recently by rummaging up a coloring book, crayons, & a little toy for a special little visitor. Everyone seems to like their job here.

Reviews.Title: “Always enjoy my stay...”
Reviews.Author: MarcRobin
Reviews.Content: Love staying in this hotel when in Dallas...located just outside the core of the city, across from the SMU campus. Easy access to highways. The staff is attentive, the lobby and outdoor seating area by the fireplace is nice and relaxing. The rooms are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: afintx
Reviews.Content: I always stay at this hotel when I come to Dallas. I lived in Dallas ( near this hotel) for 5 years and recently moved away. So whenever I come to visit family and friends I stay here. The rooms are consistently clean and decorated very nicely. The hotel is modern without being too over the top. The staff is incredibly considerate and friendly. Even the valet team is a pleasure to deal with. They always have smiles on their faces ( good sign). The food at the restaurant is excellent. They recently changed chefs and I thought the last one was very good and the new one is good as well. Added value is every night they have a "wine happy hour" in the lobby from 5-6 pm. At first I didn't go thinking it would be lame, but then I did go one evening and it was a lot of fun. The wine was actually drinkable and the snacks were delicious. I love this hotel and I will keep coming back. The location is also very convenient to SMU, shopping and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but needs to tone it down a notch”
Reviews.Author: AssimilatedCajun
Reviews.Content: There are lots of good things about the Palomar -- pleasant lobby, comfortable rooms, great location right across from the SMU campus -- but the management and staff seem to think being cool is a substitute for being excellent. This is not just a waste of energy and resources; it also detracts from the quality of the experience. I could do without the zebra-patterned bathrobes, the shampoo and lotion whose tubes are unreadable because they come in colors ranging from off-purple to bright orange with lettering in similar colors, and the jarring elevator music (not quite rap but might as well be). The staff are friendly enough, but in my several stays I've encountered a few male staff members who seem to think customers like to be addressed in the same jaunty and over-familiar tone that has been adopted in recent years by 23-year-old call-in customer service representatives. ("Mr. William Faulkner? Hope you're having a super day, Bill. How can I help you today, Bill?") An obsession with coolness often goes hand-in-hand with a tendency to be self-congratulatory. When I checked in on my most recent visit, the reception desk employee told me I was in a "one-bedroom suite". But my surprise and gratitude were fleeting, because when I got to the room it turned out to be a perfectly ordinary hotel room with just enough room for two beds, a desk, and a television set. I have encountered many hotels that will call a room a "junior suite" if it has an extra little corner or two, but this is the first time I've heard a room called a "suite" with no modifier and no extra corner. In fairness, I don't know whether it's the hotel's policy to call all of its rooms "suites" or whether this was just an exaggeration or a mistake on the part of the individual employee. On top of all this, the standard rates at the Palomar are in the same range as much nicer and more traditional hotels -- Hiltons, Sheratons, even the Intercontinental -- and there seem to be better discount/promotional rates at the other hotels. On the good side, all Kimpton hotels give you free internet if you join the Kimpton frequent traveler program, and the Palomar has free wine and hors d'oeuvres in the lobby from 5 p.m. to 6 p.m. every day. I may well stay at the Palomar again if I need to be very close to SMU. Despite some of the irritating details I've discussed in this review, it's a perfectly good hotel. But I'd be far happier if they would tone down the attitude, and even happier if the prices were better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kikivancouver
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palomar first week of March. I had a standard double queen room. Overall the place is good. The overall layout and design of the lobby is quite nice. The service at the front desk, housekeeping, and room service is very good, friendly and not phoney. The room was well appointed but the one that I had was not over the top, there was no soaker tub, things were scuffed up a bit and the bed was just ok. Pillows where really lumpy and hard and my room was facing a major freeway (noisy) so getting a good nights sleep was a bit tough. Mini bar was well stocked and toiletries were very nice. Internet costs $10 extra-which is a pet peeve of mine when you pay a good price. I did not have a chance to use the pool or gym but a colleague did and said three of the cardio machines were broken so she went for a run outside. The hotel allows pets which I enjoyed watching, they were all pretty well behaved- I could see this being a real bonus for people with dogs. Overall Dallas is nothing to write home about but if you have to go there for business or you need a place to stay the Palomar is good. I would stay here again if in town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: keylon
Reviews.Content: Hotel Palomar I loved your Kimpton style with marble floors and beautiful surroundings. The nice touches in the room were upon entering soft lighting with soothing music played and the bed was turned down - since there were two beds in the room and only one guest the first night it appeared you put thought into the fact that I was coming. love your tubes of shampoo, conditioner, bath wash and lotion - how refreshing not to try to get it out of those awkward bottles seen in most hotels. The downside to this hotel is parking and the Hot tub. The only parking available is valet. My goodness this is Dallas Texas not NYC - Dallas is spread out for over 50 miles and public transportation is not readily available - it appears there is a location adjacent to the hotel for a parking lot - I wish you would provide self parking spaces - the cost $20 per night plus tax seems crazy in Dallas Most of the other nice hotels provide this option in this city. The Hot Tub and pool were located outside on the second floor. Nice area with cabanas and comfortable chairs but the hot tub is very small for a hotel of this size - similar to a home unit - sits about 5 people comfortably - the biggest problem is the the hours it;s available. Closing at 10 pm is very early. I like to visit the hot tub just prior to bedtime around midnight. Since the pool area is not monitored by staff and it's only accessible by a keycard - why would you restrict it to certain hours? The staff were wonderful! Michael at the front desk, Daniel and Jamie who carried my luggage were names I remember but really every person I came in contact with was super nice and professional - it's very apparent they are focused on customer service! The maid who cleaned the room was professional well dressed and very attentive. I believe the people are your greatest asset. In summary - the people, location, amenities and atmosphere were wonderful. The smell of the lobby was particularly pleasant - never noticed this nice touch in other hotels but it was apparent every detail had been considered. If you will fix the parking and access to pool area it would be a perfect hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with your pets”
Reviews.Author: adgrad
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've ever taken my beloved dogs to a hotel and it was as much fun as I thought it would be based on the Palomar's website. When we arrived, we had great little dog beds. The staff brought bottled water, dog bowls, and dog treats. And, we got to let our dogs go downstairs with us to wine hour, which was much fun for a rainy night. We couldn't have loved the location more with shopping right across the street as well as a movie theatre. It was about a $10 cab ride into downtown, which was nice since it was raining (p.s. I loved Dish for dinner). And, everyone on the staff was very friendly. Hooray for Hotel Palomar for knocking it out of the park! I'm going to knock off one star simply because the rooms were super small compared to other Palomar properties I've visited. But, I wish there was a half a button because it wasn't that big of a deal.

Reviews.Title: “a golden thoughtful touch”
Reviews.Author: seri0ustraveller
Reviews.Content: I gravitate toward Kimpton Hotels when i travel. THe intimacy of the size and happy hour are usually a nice touch which makes for very good service and some quirkiness of decor. This was no exception. The modern interiors were very fresh and clean. I stayed here after a trip to Argentina and was in need of the familiar and I was especially missing my pets at home in Arizona after seeing about a half dozen dogs and their owners staying in the hotel. I mentioned this to the check in individual and she offered to have a goldfish in his bowl sent to my room to keep me company!! It was a nice homey touch. The location is near SMU and there is shopping nearby. I met and talked with a very nice clientele for happy hr and the hotel was bustlng. A stay all in all that was very pleasant and depressurizing for me on my way home.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palomar - an oasis in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Run50man
Reviews.Content: I was in Dallas for business trip and decided to try the Hotel Palomar due to it bieng close to my scheduled appts. I was a little taken by room price, but decided to give it a try. When I first walked in I was greeted by laughter and activity in the lobby and quickly asked the desk was there a convention? He responsed no, just our complimentary happy hour. What a nice surprise. Desk service was quick and pleasant as I was off to my room after grabbing a glass of wine. Room was large and comfortable and most importantly clean. It felt more like a residence than a sterile hotel room. Bed was extremely comfortable and I had a corner king with sofa and ottoman that made me feel like I was sitting in my living room. Now the true test. I ordered room service for dinner. I figured, like most hotels, this would be their demise. Not only did my order arrive within thirty minutes, it was fresh, hot and very good. The fries were so hot and fresh I had to wait for them to cool. When was the last time that happened with room service? Mini bar was well stocked. Overall a wonderful stay and I won't hesitate to stay again. Same level of service and amenities as a Ritz or Four Seasons, but wth a very comfortable and home like experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comparable to a 60's MOTEL...”
Reviews.Author: CSDines
Reviews.Content: I've never been in a Motel 6, but this is what I'd expect. From the porcelain white tile entry to the room and bathroom with FILTHY grout, to the sliding bathroom door that was too heavy to slide, the CHEAP, outdated TV... the FILTHY, fingerprinted TV cabinet... THE NOISY room through the outdated OLD windows, in BOTH rooms we saw. Yes, we complained, and yes we were given a second option before racing away from this supposed 5 star hotel to a true 5 star hotel, the Mansion on Turtle Creek. The only part of the other reviews here that is true is, there are a LOT of employees in the lobby. Why? There are probably 15. Advise... Go to the Mansion... See what class in staff really looks like. Oh, and the 2 guys behind the desk. The manager was very polite, but he was training a new kid that was clueless in a wrinkled blazer and shirt, and the shirt was a TUX SHIRT, cotton, black buttons, un ironed, no tie (on with of them, actually). 5 star? Not quite.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: Krista H
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our girl's trip to Dallas. For the first time, we stayed at Hotel Palomar, and it was truly amazing!! Everything was top-notch from the valet, check-in, room service, happy hour, to the free car service! I just can't say enough about this place. The complimentary happy hour was great after a long day of shopping and roughing it at Northpark! ha! You won't be disappointed! Ask for Eloy the concierge....he was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: doggone31
Reviews.Content: Beautiful outdoor pool, whirlpool & sundeck, well equipped fitness centre, outstanding staff and clean, comfortable rooms make this hotel great value for the price. (Seriously, the concierges are amazing.) You're right across the street from light rail, two blocks away from a supermarket and an easy drive to downtown. The small thorn to an otherwise supremely perfect stay is that the hotel is beside a freeway, which you will hear at night if your room faces the freeway. (I think odd-numbered rooms 1-15 on each floor face the freeway; and as far as hotels beside freeways, the noise isn't that bad - sort of a white noise.) Bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper or ask for a pair at the front desk. Self-park is $10 a day; consider parking in the alley or one of the side streets behind the hotel if you don't want to pay for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great room, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Cindy H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the week between Christmas and New Year's. The staff are all top notch...friendly, accommodating , and polite. Gotta love that Southern hospitality! Our suite was immaculate everyday. Definitely not the stereotype hotel food; and we had a lot of fun with the bartenders. Valets were right on top of their job, and even ran us to a local restaurant one night in the Palomar Lexus SUV. My husband and i are seasoned travelers...some good experiences, and some not so good. These guys have their act together. Won't even look to stay elsewhere next trip to Dallas. Congrats to the management and staff of Hotel Palomar Dallas. Hope to see y'all soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debra H
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Palomar Dallas hotel several times over the last six months and highly recommend it to anyone staying in the Dallas area. The personnel is wonderful, the valets great, and the rooms are clean and fresh. I love the restaurant and although I have not spent much time in the pool due to weather, there are plenty of places to find to get work or meetings done. They have a great wine hour in the evening and the best organic coffee - if you are lucky enough to stay during the holidays - you even get more treats. Cannot say enough good things about this hotel - I look forward to every trip to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: PerthSkibunny
Reviews.Content: At first the location (intersection of 2 freeways)was a little disconcerting, but soon discovered that the location to the train station etc and the quality of this hotel and its staff were all far more important. The hotel car took us to the local shopping mall, the concierge arranged basketball tickets for us on New Years Eve at a moments notice and the gym and pool were fantastic. No hesitation about recommending this hotel to anyone coming to Dallas

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: traveler54321_9
Reviews.Content: OK, I generally don't write these things, but in this case, I am compelled to thank the entire staff of the Hotel Palomar in Dallas. My son had pretty major surgery on his knee and, as a student at nearby Southern Methodist University, needed a few days of care before starting second semester classes. We have stayed at the Palomar before and loved it, but this time, we needed a little more help. We needed to move to a different room in the middle of the night. We needed two huge buckets of ice three times daily to keep the ice machine on his knee working. We needed every person, housekeeper, waiter, or other staff, to tap lightly on the door so as to not wake the patient. We needed prescriptions filled, and other items from the local CVS. We needed trips to my son's dorm room to pick up clothing and sundries. We needed middle of the night trips for other items and errands. Most of all, we needed compassionate and understanding folks to change the hotel room into a private hospital room. In no particular order, I wish to personally thank the general manager, Andrew Wright, for gifts and conveniences offered to my family. I wish to thank Kristy and Beverly at the front desk for helping me find the right room a couple of times, sending toothbrushes, a large garbage bag with rubber bands to my son could keep the bad leg dry while showering, delivering numerous other items and coordinating other support staff for my every request. I wish to thank Darin and Nick for setting up balloons and other stuff I really can't talk about to cheer up my son, not to mention the constant ice delivery at all times of the day and night. And finally to Michael who helped coordinate all of these efforts. The room was kept spotless thanks to the efforts of two really sweet housekeepers who coordinated the cleaning of the room while we were at dinner, and managed to do this while moving two machines necessary for the physical therapy on that knee. In summary, if it sounds like I'm stroking this hotel and the folks who helped me with me stay, I am. They deserve accolades, and did all that I asked and more to make this last difficult week as enjoyable as possible. I'd stay here anytime - these guys never got lost like folks in so many huge properties. Best, Dan Stratton

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Texapina
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Kimptons in the past for business trips (DC area) and it's one of the 1st hotels I'll look for when I travel, even though I have frequent stay memberships with bigger chains. I value the attention to detail paid by their staff from the moment you arrive through checkout. For instance, before our arrival, I asked and received a great email within a day from the concierge about nearby things to do with our toddler and our dogs. We were flying out of Dallas with our dogs straight to Germany and decided to stay at the Palomar vice other big-chain hotels near DFW that claimed they were pet-friendly. We stayed here for a couple of days before our move from TX to Germany, so we had a lot of luggage (Family = 2 adults, toddler & 2 dogs). We drove up from Houston LATE in the evening and were greeted promptly at the door, with a smile! The Lobby: The Palomar, like the other Kimptons I've stayed at, has a wonderfully appointed lobby complimenting the style of the building as well as that particular area of town. In this case, mod, chic and warm (loved the fireplace and comfy seating at the front door). The seating area behind the valet is also tres chic and welcoming! (I wish I'd thought to take a photo!) The Room: I'd opted for a $15/night upgrade from a deluxe double/queen room to a corner king suite and am glad I did because the L-shaped layout was perfect for us. The rate was still nearly $100/night less than the airport hotel that allowed pets. The sofabed was tucked under the corner window and was large enough for our 3 yr old that we never did make it up as a bed. Plus the wonderful down comforters and pillows made it very luxurious and comfy for her! Lots of space for all of our luggage AND the pet carrier. For the Dogs: There was a great big dog bed and biscuits to greet our travelhounds. Don't worry about dog bowls; they are provided! For dog walking, there is a dog area behind the hotel that isn't well-lit at night so keep to the front of the hotel. Other hotels charge non-refundable pet fees; don't worry about that with the Palomar. They truly are pet-friendly with no extra fees. It almost feels like pet friendly staff are also a pre-requisite! The Minibar: Definitely join Kimpton InTouch; their Raid the Mini Bar was much appreciated after a long drive ($10 credit!). Also, I was able to reserve a yoga kit (yoga mat, block, DVD) in the room upon arrival--not every Kimpton has this as an option, but all Kimptons have an on-site or nearby fitness center/gym as well as spa arrangement. The Palomar has an arrangement with exhale, the spa next door (and a coupon for % off on a visit). Room Service: Room service was prompt on both mornings and yummy (our tot loved the homemade whipped cream that came with the fruit & the waffles). The waitstaff, ACTUALLY ALL THEIR STAFF, are incredibly attentive. (I mentioned my daughter really liked the whipped cream and could I get it as a side with her dinner; voila! there it was) MISC: The business center has a printer and 2 computers. Faxes are at the front desk. (We used both) The quieter rooms are towards the back, which is lovely for late wakeups (the other side is the freeway). There's a lovely outdoor pool (too chilly for this visit) and hot tub too. Since we were there to decompress from the move and holidays before a long flight overseas, we didn't really tour around the area, but I plan to do so when we return to Texas. We did walk over to a nearby shopping center for an afternoon outing (last minute shopping at Whole Food Provisions Company, a family fave; Jason's Deli--quick, family friendly fare). All in all, my family truly appreciated the bit of extra pampering here!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: elriotravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. The service was fantastic and the rooms and amenities were incredibly nice, even the bathrobes were great. They have a nice cocktail reception in the evening and a great coffee bar in the morning. The location near the SMU campus is beautiful with easy access to the highways. The rooftop pool is also a great bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Lobby and close to DART Rail”
Reviews.Author: charlibeth
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Palomar. Everyone was friendly and super helpful and right across the street is an outdoor mall and movie theater that plays mostly indy films. We stayed here one night because we were going to the Cotton Bowl stadium the next day. We didn't bring a car so we relied on public transportation all weekend and this hotel was perfect for that. It was a $22 (incldng tip) cab ride from Love field and with the DART rail being right across the street, we were able to take the red/blue line all the way down to right in front of the stadium which was perfect! Every night there is a free wine happy hour in the lobby and the door man gave us a great tip on the hot tub. Get there before 10pm because the doors lock so no one can get in, but you can still leave no problem. I would definitely stay here again on our next visit to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Cotton Bowl visit to dallas”
Reviews.Author: Missouri64
Reviews.Content: We visited Dallas to attend the Cotton Bowl on January 4-7. We chose to stay in Dallas to be near the shopping and restaurants. The Palomar has a terrific location near 75 highway and Mockingbird Ln. It's near Highland Park Village, SMU and Northpark Mall. The spacious suite was perfect for our family. It almost felt like an apt. Minus a kitchen. Very chic, with a nice sized bathroom, spa tub and walk in shower. The living room area was open with enough space for everyone's "stuff". The staff was very friendly and delivered extra linens very promptly every time we were in need. The valet staff knew our car and our name after the first time we dropped off our car, it was always brought around quickly. They also have a complimentary car that will drop off/pick up if needed. Cocktail hour is short, we seemed to miss is most days, but it was a nice amenity. The only downfall was the traffic noise on 75 hwy at night, it went on all night long, but you are in a city,

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: roseguinea
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. Very dog friendly and the service was impeccable. Rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. Coffee/tea service in the morning in the lobby was so great!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a prime location.”
Reviews.Author: rbaron721
Reviews.Content: Nice, soft contemporary look. Comfortable beds, cool decor, quite rooms. Pretty simple and good experience. Service was excellent. Didn't eat at the restaurant but there appears to be a decent bar scene in the bar off of the lobby. They are per friendly. I wish I would have known that and I would have brought my dog. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a convinient location in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: mareku
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in this hotel during the X-mas period in 2011. The Palomar Hotel chain is setting new standards in service, friendliness (to humans and animals alike) and quality at reasonable price levels. The Palomar Dallas is no exception. Convenient located near Highland Park, SMU Stadium and Mockingbird Station all your favorite things in Dallas are close (Downtown - North Park Mall e.g.). The only downside is that the noise of US 75 is always clearly on the background and even when you can open the window of your room - you probably do not want to do that. The hotel is modern, has great rooms with comfy beds. Bathroom is clean and nice. Lobby not big - but with free wine tasting in the afternoon. Pool and outside area quiet and cool. The restaurant Central 214 is ok, but nothing special. There are plenty of other restaurants options in the neighborhood - even a couple on walking distance. Wifi Internet coverage and speed is great and free. And do expect to see cute (puppy) dogs in this hotel, because they are pet friendly. If you want to run - just across the street the Kathy Trial starts - where everyone is running and where you can run 3.5 miles - or more... Don't forget to stop on your way at the excellent Luke's Locker running shop.

Reviews.Title: “Great! Great! Great!”
Reviews.Author: starickman
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for two nights at the Palomar while visiting colleges in the Dallas area. This particular hotel is just across the freeway from Southern Methodist University. The service was excellent, room exceptionally clean and nice, and valet parking (mandatory) was quick and friendly. There are many restaurants nearby and you are right off Hwy. 35 so you can get to other locations in the Dallas area quickly. The valet parking is required so that adds to your hotel cost, but they always got the car quickly. It does not come with a free breakfast, but does have coffee/hot chocolate in the lobby. The pool area also looked nice and even though it was cold some guests were swimming, so it must be heated.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jean5muskogee
Reviews.Content: Attended a Bowl Game at SMU and stayed at the Palomar Hotel. I was surprised at how nice the hotel was. From the outside I really didn't expect to have such a nice hotel. It reminded me of the nice hotels in Las Vegas that we have stayed before. Everyone was so nice. I can't say enough about this hotel. They really bend over backwards to meet your every need. Comfortable beds, I received a great promotional price with credit for food. The food was great and the service was wonderful. I left refreshed and will be back to stay. I recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jim C
Reviews.Content: spent a get-away one night here and loved it. great design, fabulous lobby, bar, restaurant, room, comfortable bed, and perfect central location. will always stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Romantic Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Erin B
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel to celebrate my husband's birthday. We were welcomed with friendly and helpful faces. When checking in, the staff asked if we were staying for a specific reason and we said a birthday celebration. About an hour after checking in room service brought up a bottle of champagne and a plate of strawberries with a sweet happy birthday note! The wine reception was perfect before dinner at Central 214. If you eat at Central 214, make sure to save room for the chocolate waffle! It is AMAZING...and I'm not a chocolate lover!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for SMU football game”
Reviews.Author: lucyaf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in the Fall to go to a SMU game (he is an alumuni). When we checked in we were greeted with a glass of wine and met what I assume was one of the managers at the bar. The lobby was warm and welcoming and the valet parking really easy. The location was perfect for what we were in town for. We could easily walk to the stadium and enjoyed a late lunch at La Madeleine. We enjoyed both the pool and bar/restaurant while we were there. The service was top notch and we would definitely stay there the next time we are in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Our "go-to" hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Rodney H
Reviews.Content: Love seeing the occasional dog in the lobby, the wine happy hour, the spacious rooms and the attentive staff. An amazing value for such a first class operation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: Elbell189
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Hotel Palomar. The staff is wonderful, kind and always willing to help in whatever you need. The free wine hour every day is a wonderful little bonus. The property is gorgeous and rooms were spacious and very nicely decorated! The location is perfect near everything you could possibly need and very close to highway access for anything else. The hotel is in a very nice part of dallas and is near many high class shops and dinig. I highly recommend this place and will definitely return when I'm back in the Dallas area

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton! 'nuff said”
Reviews.Author: SebGo
Reviews.Content: Kimpton hotels have never disappointed me, and the Hotel Palomar in Dallas was no exception. From the valets to the front desk staff, they were all friendly. The "living room" (i.e. lobby) was warm and welcoming and the gym facility, while small, was clean and well-equipped. My only regret was that i wasn't there long enough to partake of the spa and classes that were offered. I'd never been to Dallas before, and this hotel made the experience great.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: declanmantis
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small-ish hotel, decorated in soothing neutral colors and a lot of wood. The rooms are comfortable and tastefully decorated, with excellent beds and marble bathrooms containing good quality toiletries (plus cotton balls, q-tips, and magnifying make-up mirrors). I also appreciated the in-room safe and iron/ironing board. The staff are incredibly helpful and friendly, and the lobby is a peaceful place to lounge during the 5pm wine tasting offered to guests. The food in the restaurant is fresh and delicious, with a good selection of salads, sandwiches, and seafood-chicken-beef entrees (around $14). I will stay at this hotel every time I travel to Dallas -- it is conveniently located and feels like home.

Reviews.Title: “Palomar”
Reviews.Author: MILLER39
Reviews.Content: Great hotel very well located for my travel, but not center city. Very good cafe and fine room. Shuttle service was poor as most Kimpton Hotels are.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: jaimemdunlap
Reviews.Content: Loved our wknd at the Palomar! Great location, incredible service, nice room! We got a special rate on the website and it was a great deal. I will be back again, no question!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in Every Detail”
Reviews.Author: Rahsaan
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with Kimpton properties and Palomar is no exception. It has all the features you expect from a top-notch hotel. It is intimate rather than overwhelming, very tasteful rather than over the top, and very easy to get around. Other hotels wow you with their scale; Palomar seduces you with their service. You would think this hotel has the potential to be snooty but it is not. For example, the wine reception in the lobby was welcoming and casual. I was treated like royalty but in a respectful and professional manner. Then there is Eloy. He was the concierge on duty when we arrived and was a great asset. He recommended an outstanding contemporary mexican restaurant (Komali) in our price range, made reservations, and arranged to have the courtesy car drop us off. When we returned he mentioned that a scarf was left behind and that their car was going to collect it from the restaurant and deliver to my room. I also found myself out of contact lens solution and he arranged to have it delivered to my room about 10 minutes later. The only drawback was that my room had some residual road noise from the expressway but you can avoid this but requesting a room on a different side. It was not bad enough for me to request a change. Well done! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “If you travel with your dog...”
Reviews.Author: NoisyCricket
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar with our dog during the Thanksgiving holiday. Visualize this......we arrive at the front entry of the hotel at 3am after a 12 hour car trip...with our dog and enough luggage and dog stuff to require two luggage trolleys. Just what every hotel night shift looks forward to with delight. Charming Josh greeted us at reception and quickly got us settled with no fuss. The room was great. Very comfortable beds. Clean and fresh looking decor. The lobby was delightful. One nice perk we had not counted on....our parking charge for our hybrid was waived. A nice savings. The location was perfect. Near NorthPark shopping and cute boutiques right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: 123KMH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our 5 year anniversaryâ€¦ it was amazing. I could have stayed in the room the whole time. The hugeâ€¦ huge tub was a super plus for me. They were so nice and I loved that water always in the lobby for me and the wine reception in the afternoon. Beautiful rooms. I have stayed at a lot of hotels and the room was one of the best! They gave us strawberries and champagne and hand wrote a nice letter congratulating us on 5 years. It was so nice and I cant wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: eyesoftexas6
Reviews.Content: There are some really stellar reviews of this hotel on Trip Advisor, and I have to say that I am puzzled. I did answer the survey that Kimpton Hotel customer service routinely sends out, but why am I NOT surprised that the hotel manager did not follow up, as (s)he does for Trip Advisor postings? I stayed at the hotel as part of a wedding weekend, but was informed by customer service that they would not give me the same rate for an extra night, as the wedding organizer had not requested this. Nonsense, and very poor outreach to your client. The person at the checkout desk was rude and abrupt, not skipping a beat to answer the phone in the middle of a conversation with the customer in front of him. There is a sports bar/restaurant featuring very prominently on the hotel marquee as if it is an integral part of the hotel. Kimpton customer service accepts no responsibility for the quality of food and service there. The food was unspeakable, the salad was served on the buffet after dessert as they forgot about it, and the tables for our private party of 50 people were not cleared. The food in Restaurant 214 inside the hotel was pricey and average at best. My hotel room was very poorly lit and would have benefited by the services of a competent interior designer. One armchair in a room clearly for two people, an inexplicably heavy and inefficient bathroom sliding door. The beds were very good and the toiletries provided luxurious, but why no shower cap, and why does one have to ask for makeup mirror in a pricey room? I have had a better TV screen in a much less pretentious hotel. I would not choose to book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Australian Shepherd was pampered from the time we arrived.”
Reviews.Author: S D M
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Dallas for the Thanksgiving Holiday and received a very good deal on our room at the Hotel Palomar Dallas. We wanted to take our Australian Shepherd with us so I searched for a pet friendly hotel. Not only were they pet friendly but they were pet pampering. They brought him his own plush bed, food bowl with food and bottled water - He loved his bed. They provide an area to walk your pet close to the hotel. The food in the restaurant we excellent also. They were booked solid for Thanksgiving but when I called to make reservations and they found out we were staying at the hotel, they were able to get us a table. It was a wonderful Thanksgiving for our family and our spoiled baby, Rocket. We are definitely looking forward to going back again.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful welcome to Texas”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte S
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Texas before. We arrived from the UK and went straight to the Palomar. We were really 'bowled over' by the extraordinarily helpful and friendly staff - at all levels. The hotel itself was nicely decorated and attractive, and there were some very nice touches - like complimentary wine and snacks for 'happy hour', coffee in the morning and so on. A lovely pool area.

Reviews.Title: “A special treat.”
Reviews.Author: Krissylong
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Such a fun and upbeat hotel . Loved the coffee/hot chocolate bar and of course the wine reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, pleasure to stay there.”
Reviews.Author: Tim T
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in Mid November 2011. Very friendly and efficient staff, clean bedroom and good in house service at the restaurant and direct to the room. I especially enjoyed the complimentary hot chocolate with marshmallows in the foyer each morning!

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: David P
Reviews.Content: Two thumbs up! Best location, easy to travel uptown - downtown. Bar and restaurant are super!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: NYC York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “Palomar Kimpton Dallas - Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Nigel E
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Palomar Dallas Kimpton last week on a business trip from NYC and had a terrific stay. Service was exceptional from check in staff, bartenders, dinner at the hotel's restaurant and especially the hotel service staff who were so accomodating that they went out and bought me a contact lens case when I called down to see if they had that item in their front desk supplies. They didn't carry lens cases so they went and bought me one and it was left in my room and I found it there when I returned from my dinner downstairs. Great experience and exceptional service and glad that they have staff members who care enough to make the extra effort required to make me feel important. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “A little taste of heaven...”
Reviews.Author: docbeck
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a Kimpton hotel. We loved every aspect of our stay. We will definitely be booking with Kimpton again, not only in Dallas, but in other locations as well.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave....”
Reviews.Author: G W
Reviews.Content: I had a great time I had during my stay at your hotel. Everyone went above and beyond in my opinion. I stayed November 1st â€“ the 5th, and quite frankly wasn't sure I wanted to leave. My first experience was at the front desk with Kristy Ayoulo, upbeat and full of helpful information. I later went to the restaurant for dinner where I met Fran, who was very accommodating in finding me a warm location in the restaurant to sit in, and always checking to see that I was happy. My waiter, Matt was there with everything I needed and so very polite. I also met the Chef who came by to ask if I was enjoying my meal, to which of course the answer was yes. All of the valets were FABULOUS. They were so nice and I am pretty sure in my five days I met everyone of them. I used the hotel car to get back and forth to my class, so all of them had to put up with me at one time or another. The Palomar really has a great group of guys. And last but certainly not least was Eloy. He helped me set up my transportation back to the airport and gave me recommendations for restaurants in the area. Upon my arrival at one of the eateries one of their staff opened the door and I was greeted by name. They said Eloy had called them and said that I was on my way, I was very touched by his thoughtfulness.

Reviews.Title: “One sister two dogs”
Reviews.Author: Sharob2
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at a Kimpton and we were very happy with the choice. We stayed three days on our way home after a month long trip. We decided that this would be a resting spot for us. We couldn't have picked a nicer place. Everyone was very nice. The room was clean and we had a great view of the pool area. We didn't use the pool but it looked very nice and well kept. The reason I wanted to stopped in Dallas is it had been years since we had been there and I wanted to see the bronze statues of the long horns near the convention center. If you get the chance go see them it is a great piece of art work. We found parking very easy and everyone was very friendly took some great pictures. Downtown was very quiet when we went. Did drive thru the tourist area but wasn't interest in anything there. Our hotel was right off the freeway and I mean right off we passed the entrance when we checked in and came in the wrong way but the valet said no problem. But when we came back the second time I was able to find it with no problem. The concierge Jon Paul is wonderful he will help you find anything you need. Our valet Roberto was also very kind. We choose the Kimpton's because they are dog friendly and will treat your pet like one of the family. This was a wonderful hotel for us to stay at and catch our breath before we continue on home. We will keep it on our list.

Reviews.Title: “Dreamy... Look forward to staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: ladyupnorth03
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay all the way around! My suite was wonderful... extrememly clean, great decor, great windows for daylight and excellent shades for sleeping, the best pillows I've had in a hotel. Bathroom was spectacular, with a shower that I didn't want to get out of! Marble and glass enclosed with unbelievable water pressure from the showerhead. A super deep jacuzzi tub that could have fit 4 people! Seperate vanity area, and plenty of closet space. Big fluffy towels and soft sheets on the bed. Great mini bar and snack offerings. Turn down service included a bottle of water and bedside light left on. The true gem of this property is the staff. Not only was every need met before asking, the valet, front desk, and concierge all remembered my name all weekend. I never saw a guest that was not greeted with a smile and a hello. There is a great sports bar right around the corner, which was great for Saturday afternoon. The pool / hot tub area is beautiful, and you can have food or beverages delivered there. There is also a complimentary wine tasting every night in the lobby, which was delightful. The lobby bar was busy both nights, yet service remained friendly, fast and accurate. The property is right off the highway, and easy to get to and from. Valet parking only. Hotel Palomar got it right! Can't wait to return on my next trip to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “traveler's dream”
Reviews.Author: Sara M
Reviews.Content: From the morning's free organic coffee&fresh cream to the super comfy bedding, Dallas's Palomar is hands-down, our favorite choice. After a hard day's work, we were greeted by name by the very friendly,yet professional front desk staff. After some time of being a member of the Kimpton group, one is evidently given a "raid the snack bar" token and sometimes spa passes. The bar area is active with clean-cut professionals,and the outdoor seating with comfortable chairs/sofas and fireplace is the perfect setting for a cocktail.The restaurant has an interesting menu,and the food is generally very good. The rooms are spacious and well-appointed.There is also an on-site business center. This is a dog-friendly hotel,if one is interested. Overall, we only stay at the Palomar while in Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Superb, top notch hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BanditAngel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from Oct 27-31.2011 and couldn't have had a more splendid time! The room was ultra luxurious..the staff was more than exceptional..service was fast..the concierge's were very very helpful with restaurant suggestions, things to do etc..They offered us a courtesy car to take us places (within 3 miles) with pick up after we were done..They had a wine hour open to guests in the lobby every day..and every mornign fresh coffee, tea for the guests..Great outdoor courtyard space with fireplace..Amazing EXhale spa attached to property..Excellent bellmen/valets..And to top it all of..a beautiful goldfish in our room which we named Paloma..Oh..and the food was great as well! definitely recommend this hotel property to anyone visiting Dallas..A for sure repeat hotel shoud I return!! Thank you Palomar..You made my stay that much more enjoyable!!

Reviews.Title: “A Corsey”
Reviews.Author: Angie C
Reviews.Content: This was hands down one of the best hotel that I have stayed in. The service and the accommodations were phenomenal. I would recommend this place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Get Breakfast for $1”
Reviews.Author: D Dawn K
Reviews.Content: This is a GREAT place to stay - for a staycation or traveling through Dallas. Pros: Free wine tasting each evening, great location close to downtown Dallas on I-75, great spa, nice pool and hot tub area (they will serve drinks and food at the pool, but you call from a phone at the pool to have it delivered), rooms very clean and spacious, quiet rooms, great decor, restaurant has organic and vegan options (overall great food). There is a small group of speciality shops and restaurants right across the street--including a movie theatre. Overall, this is a great hotel for the rates. Front desk staff very attentive and friendly. Cons: Not much. You have to valet park - there is no other option, so bring cash for tipping. Also, the condos on property share the pool area, so during more crowded times of the year, you'll be sharing the chairs/loungers with them. Dallas folks are friendly - no worries there, just might be a space issue if you have a larger group during peak times.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay near SMU and Highland Park.”
Reviews.Author: NonnieLonnie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our first trip to Dallas to visit family and will definitely make it our place to stay on future visits. We had a wonderful experience at this beautifully appointed hotel with 55 star service.

Reviews.Title: “Another Awesome Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Heather C
Reviews.Content: This place is top of the line. From the minute we arrived, we were greeted by first name and the front desk was so helpful with dinner plans at Central Restaurant (located in the hotel). The restaurant was excellent and we LOVED the outside patio area, which is located behind the restaurant. The room was awesome - we stayed in the Luxury King and loved the sofa that looked out onto Mockingbird Lane. We will definetly be back!

Reviews.Title: “My Stay at Palomar”
Reviews.Author: Todd M
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations for the Palomar (as a Kimpton Hotel)--and they were exceeded. Every detail has just that little touch that made you go--"COOL"! Friendly, charming staff, and guests that no doubt contributes to the easy feel--guests were happy and were willing to chat on the elevators. Cool music, enchanting atmosphere inside and out. My new favorite Kimpton, and by far my favorite in Dallas Texas.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay at the Palomar”
Reviews.Author: Jackie R
Reviews.Content: This was a "package" offer I read about in the Austin American-Statesman Sunday Travel Section in early October. The rate sounded good and the free metrorail fare to and from the State Fair. Then to top it all off, the offer of a free meal with one purchased. When we drove up to the hotel we were impressed by its design and style. Check-in was fast and efficient, as was the valet parking of our vehicle. We were greeted warmly at the reception desk and everything the package offered was gone over, including the unexpected treat of "raiding" the mini bar of up to $10 of goodies. We were impressed with the sleek design and comfort of our room and appreciated the choice of TV channels on the HD TV. We got directions to the metrorail for our evening at the fair. Afterward, we spent a comfortable night in a very quiet room. In the morning we asked the manager and hostess at the restaurant if our state fair ticket stubs would work for breakfast as we would not be around later for dinner. Without hesitation, they agreed, and we enjoyed delicious waffles and an omelet as our meal(s). We would have liked to stay longer to take advantage of the fitness center and the pool, but we had to head back to Austin. We will definitely stay at the Palomar our next time in Dallas and certainly pick a Kimpton Hotel if available wherever our travels may take us. Thank you Palomar and Kimpton for making our hotel stay most delightful and our trip so enjoyable! Jackie Rollins Austin, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Palomar OU/Texas weekend”
Reviews.Author: soccergirl_58
Reviews.Content: My familiy and I recently stayed at The Palomar ... our stay was terrific..from the time the valet took our keys to the time we were drove away it was a great expirience. High marks in all areas. Considering this was a very hectic weekend the hotel coped with it very well. Our rooms were clean, service was excellent. It was a great location for dinning, shopping and the the Cototn Bowl.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: crea2011
Reviews.Content: We stay here every year during OU/Texas weekend and could not be happier. The location is perfect and close to everywhere we want to go. The hotel staff is very courteous and helpful, and the concierge ranks as one of the best. He dropped everything he was doing to get us dinner reservations at the last minute on a Saturday night. The pool area is relaxing and Exhale spa has some good massage therapists. The fitness room is small, but it has everything that you need to get a good workout. There is also a 7-mile jogging trail very close to the hotel. The restaurant, 214, has delicious food and a very friendly chef. He personally stopped by twice to make sure everything was to our satisfaction. The nightly wine reception and use of the house car are also added bonuses. If you are coming to the Dallas area, I would highly recommend staying at Hotel Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in dallas”
Reviews.Author: jilek_dani
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice place at a good price and the staff are pleasant and helpful . What more could you ask . Location is great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Average Experience”
Reviews.Author: MSM1685
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several Kimpton properties and I must say I was surprised by my experience at the Dallas Palomar. The front desk staff was not as pleasant as usual, and the rooms were a bit dated. My biggest issue with my room was the shower/water pressure - terrible for the price you are paying to stay. One positive - the concierge was super helpful, made some great suggestions for dinner, and even called ahead to the restaurant and sent our table some complimentary appetizers. The house car is also a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: stussy5555
Reviews.Content: Location is good. Room was nice, minus the bathroom door which is hard too close and allows no privacy. Water pressure was bad as well. Also, make sure you don't get a room next to the highway, it's loud! Internet is $10 per day, seems steep to me. The worst part of the trip is that we had a gold fish put in our room. The fish had no air ventilation and was in a tiny square vase. He was vibrant the first day and then on day two ye would barely move. It was completely inhumane. We called the front desk to come get the fish because it looked in bad shape. No one came. We stopped by the front desk and asked again, still no one came. Finally after contacting them for the third time they came and got the fish. I wouldn't stay at a Kimpton again.

Reviews.Title: “Great week-end getaway!”
Reviews.Author: colburnc
Reviews.Content: My adult daughters and I stayed a couple of days in Dallas for some shopping and were impressed with the service and beauty of Hotel Palomar. The pool was gorgeous! It was convenient to several nice stores and easy driving distance for many others. I was a little disappointed that all parking was valet since most places that are NOT downtown have free parking, but that's really my only complaint. If you are a dog-person, this is an especially great place for you. If you are NOT, you might want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buckwilli
Reviews.Content: Great facility, very similar to other Palomar hotels. Good location, pretty easy to get just about anywhere in Dallas. Have stayed here several times, but only just found out about the hotel courtesy car that will take and pick you up anywhere within 3 miles from the hotel. Free wi-fi if you sign up for the free Kimpton member thing. Free wine in the lobby in the afternoons. Great government rates if you are a state or federal employee.

Reviews.Title: “Always pampered at the Palomar!”
Reviews.Author: GoinCruizin2008
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another stay at the Hotel Palomar in Dallas. This hotel does customer service better than anywhere. The valets are there with a smile and friendly welcome, quick to assist with luggage, packages, etc and ready to take care of the care. The front desk is extremely prompt and love the service in the bar and restaurant. There is nothing better than relaxing in the lounge after a busy day and enjoying the decor, yummy hors d'oeuvres and a tasty beverage while unwinding. Love that there is always pitchers of ice water, with blueberries or other fruit waiting upon arrival. Love the rooms, decor and comfort of the cozy beds and the soft music playing when we come back. The music by the pool is very relaxing a a great way to rejuvenate after a long day. Can't wait to return! Thanks Hotel Palomar for being our home away from home but with more pampering!

Reviews.Title: “awesome hptel”
Reviews.Author: KarlawhiteNY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Palomar this past weekend. The hotel is easily accessible from the freeway and close to the action downtown. We stayed in a king spa room. The jetted tub was a dream. It was large, deep, and quite relaxing. I felt like in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: jimc5240
Reviews.Content: This is the nicest place I've ever stayed in Dallas. The hotel is great and the service was beyond all my expectations. It was competively priced but gave the same service you would get at much more exclusive, and expensive, properties. I will always choose them first when in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Top-Notch Service, Immaculate and Modern”
Reviews.Author: Tara M
Reviews.Content: I was here recently for a full week on business. All of our meetings were in the hotel. Everything was great - from the meeting rooms to the sleeping rooms, the catering services, Audio Visual, to the bellhops. I was always greeted by a friendly smile when walking past an employee. The rooms (both meeting and sleeping) were very clean with modern furnishings. I loved the pool, gym, and outdoor decor. Right next door is Brackets sports bar, and across the street is a great shopping center with restaurants and shops. Whether for business or pleasure, this hotel will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Week long meeting”
Reviews.Author: Charlie H
Reviews.Content: Spending a week away from home on business is never fun, however the staff at the Palomar in Dallas made the trip more than tolerable. The service at Palomar was excellent and the premises were clean and updated. When staying here, any questions or needs are readily handled by the finest concierge in the business, Eloy Calvo.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern, great location”
Reviews.Author: eyoungdallas
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a "staycation" this weekend at Hotel Palomar in Dallas. It's centrally located a few miles north of downtown, near SMU and Park Cities. This is a rehab of an older hotel, and the remodel is just beautiful. I'd enjoyed happy hour there (great) as well as a few dinners, but this is the only time I've stayed as an overnight guest. The room was spacious (we had 2 full beds) and the amenities were first class. The breakfast (room delivery) was promptly delivered, but was only OK, i.e., could have been a little hotter. That is the only (very minor) criticism I have of this beautiful gem of a hotel. I will not hesitate to put guests up there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great service, good location”
Reviews.Author: Matt_UKTX
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Palomar for a night on the town with a few guy friends. Overall the hotel was very nice. The rooms are nicely furnished, the beds are comfortable, and the bathrooms are modern. Service was also friendly and excellent. Pros and cons for this hotel are as follows: PROS: - Good location (short cab ride to several bars and restaurants) - Excellent Service - Great Hotel Bar and Restaurant (Central 214) - Clean and modern CONS: - Expensive for what it is. $250 per night is too much, $150 per night would be a fair price. - No free parking. This should be free in a $250 per night hotel. In summary, staying here was a good experience and I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Really relaxing, stylish, effortless property”
Reviews.Author: BrookMeakins
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Palomar for two nights during a recent work trip (my work was by the pool- rough, I know!). The staff was professional and friendly, the facilities were beautiful and inviting, we were offered a complimentary upgrade, and the food/drinks were delicious. We took a six mile walk one evening right from the hotel and had a wonderful time- what a great location. We had a great experience at this property and have no reason to venture elsewhere for our next trip to Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Great Property!”
Reviews.Author: CAWeekender29
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip and was very pleased with the hotel. The room was comfortable with a nice reading chair, lots of natural light, a good number of power outlets and a recently updated bathroom with plenty of counter space. The gym was well maintained and had a good variety of equip for both cardio, free weights, a few machines and a stretch bar. The pool was a relaxing place to relax at night. Friendly service and an overall good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: TGS67
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, although not as nice as we expected. Not coffee maker, not free internet, not self parking, noisy room... Next visit to Dallas, we probably will stay in another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's my home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: ginger b
Reviews.Content: The Palomar makes for effortless travel. From check-in to check-out, the staff anticipates your every need! The rooms are lux and spotless, I even let my baby crawl on the floor!

Reviews.Title: “Business for my husband, luxury tag-a-long for me!”
Reviews.Author: BigBdMaMa
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered this establishment I knew I had made the right choice. The lobby is inviting and the flavored waters to cool you were so welcome in 110 degree heat1 The staff is willing to help you with any needs above and beyond the comfort of the hotel stay. The restaurant is sublime and the sous chef, Simon, came and asked us if we were pleased with his creations and sat and chatted with us at dinner, a welcome addition to our meal. I saw many dinners being enjoyed by patrons having a nice romantic dinner alone or with business associates talking at leaisure about their days progress. There is also outdoor dining but the temperatures did not make that a good choice. There is also a menu for children and a lovely bar. We took three trips here and our projects was over. Kudos!

Reviews.Title: “On business - recommended!”
Reviews.Author: WilliamSNichols
Reviews.Content: Two night stay at Palomar Dallas. Traveled for business. The concierge was very helpful and recommended a great Mexican restaurant nearby. There is a great infinity pool with plenty of seating; they pump in some loud trance-like music, which is nice if you're into that. The infused waters -- think ice water with fresh fruit -- all around the hotel was a nice touch. The hotel bar was a happening place from 5pm until after midnight -- but please don't infer that I spent 7 straight hours at a hotel bar. Unfortunately, I didn't get a chance to eat a meal at the hotel, but the dinner menu looked fantastic. One menu item: prosciutto-wrapped mozzarella....wait for it....deep-fried. Yes. Deep-fried cheese wrapped in cured meat. I'd opt for a turn-down service that leaves one of these on my pillow. Too oily? Deal with it. The front desk was helpful in arranging transportation to dinner and to the airport. Bed was extremely comfortable; briefly considered taking entire mattress home, but was traveling carry-on only and was thus limited by luggage size. We hosted a business event in their large function room. Hotel staff was welcoming and helpful. The event ran very smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and comfortable...predictably Kimpton!”
Reviews.Author: 67HaveKidsWillTravel
Reviews.Content: As always, Kimpton doesn't fail to please! We recently stayed at the Palomar in Dallas and thoroughly enjoyed our visit -- from the morning coffee to the evening wine, with a visit to the fitness center and relaxing pool in between. The location is great. Staff was friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable, although I wish it had two queens instead of doubles. We love Kimpton Hotels and this one met our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: Poncho56
Reviews.Content: Superb 4 Star Hotel. Stayed for a week on a business trip. Check in was quick which was great after such a long flight. Concierge and the guys at the door were first class , they provided the hotel courtesy car on several occasions. Pool area was quiet maybe due to the 40+ temperatures.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but more like a 3.5 star”
Reviews.Author: Ron_L_64
Reviews.Content: Very nice, excellent service, bed was very comfy. Negatives: some of the room furniture was dated and a little banged up, mandatory valet parking at $20/night, annoying charge for internet service unless you sign up for hotel club.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great location, good service, terrible meals.”
Reviews.Author: KimABerry
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to the SMU campus. It's hard to get into and out of the valet/reception area. Service is very nice but what you would expect for $200/night. The food in the restaurant is AWFUL - don't even waste your time with appetizers. We ordered several items. The most memorable was a terrible fried lobster appetizer that was served with a completely unappetizing sauce (my daughter said it looked like vomit) and strawberry jelly on top of the lobster. ?!? With every item, we all thought the chef was tossing everything he or she could find onto the plate and hoping it might "work." The fitness center is nice but small. We thought it was odd that the Palomar would offer bottles of water to their guests at valet but not in the gym. They offer a complimentary wine tasting in the lobby but we did not attend. The pool is beautiful. After driving 800 miles in one day, braving dinner in the restaurant and being absolutely exhausted, it was lovely to go up to the roof at 10pm (when it was still 95 degrees) and soak our tired legs in the spa. Room service and housekeeping were both terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Service!”
Reviews.Author: aemcneill
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for one night to celebrate our anniversarry. The hotel went out of there way to make our stay extra special. The room was beautiful, the pool was relaxing and the food was very good. The other positive reviews are all correct, you cannot go wrong with the Palomar!

Reviews.Title: “Best Staycation Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: black_takara
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was a fantastic hotel. We called 15 minutes before normal checkout time to request late checkout and they let us do it. The room was beautiful, the view was beautiful, and overall the hotel was beautiful. Wine hour was a lot of fun and there was a touch of Texas in everything (Texas Sweet Tea in the morning, Sweet Tea Vodka from a local producer, subtle cowboy theme in the lobby, etc...). The hotel staff were wonderful...especially Jerry, Rachel, Jordan, Karina and Darren! We will definitely be back for another stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, quiet, excellent food”
Reviews.Author: bluecato
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palomar for three nights to attend a high school reunion, and the hotel was an excellent choice. This hotel used to be a Hilton, where I stayed several times. The Hilton was a nice hotel, but this new Kimpton is even nicer. The decor is modern but attractive and welcoming. Check-in was smooth and fast. My room was large, with a king bed, desk, flat screen TV, comfortable chairs, and attractive bath. The wi-fi worked well, and a business center was available for printing boarding passes and the like. The room service menu offered interesting choices for both breakfast and dinner. I was a little disappointed that no selection of Texas wine was available, but some visitors would probably mark that as a bonus! One nice touch was the chilled peach iced tea offered in the lobby every day. As the natives know, iced tea is the true table wine of Texas. The hotel is located at the intersection of Mockingbird Lane and Central Expressway (I45). That location is near SMU and convenient for tourism or business in the northeastern part of Dallas. However, pure tourists might be better off to stay in downtown Dallas, which would be closer to the principal museums and historical sites. The one negative for the hotel is that only valet parking is available, and it is rather expensive. Still, I would glady stay at the Palomar again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palomar is the Best!”
Reviews.Author: missdbn
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a long weekend at Hotel Palomar is Dallas with our two early 20's sons. Having stayed at Hotel Palomar in Chicago(which is also the best!) we decided to try the Palomar in Dallas. The location was perfect for our needs and the rate was comparable to other hotels that we looked at. From the time we arrived to the time we left, we could not have asked for better service in any area of the hotel. Although we drove, we still took advantage of the complimentary car service at night so that we could have fun and not worry about driving. The temperatures were in the 100s, so we really appreciated that our car was parked in a garage, not a lot. There were plenty of taxis there when we needed one and the valet service was very prompt. It's the extras that the Palomar does that makes it stand out. The morning coffee,the blueberry water always available and the flavored tea in the lobby after being in the heat and of course the wine and hor d'ourvres at 5:00. All complimentary along with bottles of water at night by your bed. I dropped a glass of tea in the lobby and the response was "totally no big deal and lets get you another one." So accommodating!! The rooms were spacious and very clean. The bathrooms also very clean, well lit and there was undercounter storage which I really like for all of my "stuff" We did join the Kimpton group before arriving, so that gave us free wifi in our rooms which was really nice because I just had gotten a new ipad! We did not use the spa, fitness center or pool, but we did check it out and it all looked very nice. The staff was polite, professional, and gracious, without being stuffy. They really do make you feel at home. I will definitely stay there again and also highly recommend it to anyone who is visiting Dallas (or Chicago)

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: JohnF_Texas
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff was friendly and the overall experience was fantastic. Goldfish in the room was a cool touch

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingT
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for one night, but I will definitely stay here again when I'm in Dallas. My main reason for chosing this hotel was because it was advertised as pet friendly. I received a warm welcome when I arrived. The man at the check in desk was very friendly--quick and easy. The room was modern and clean. The valet was great too. Anytime I needed my vehicle, it was waiting for me when I got downstairs. Very great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Traceefeik
Reviews.Content: I was impressed from the moment we arrived and they delivered my children two goldfish for their stay! I loved the complementary happy hour as well. The pool area was very upscale, clean and nice. I can't wait to go back and stay again!

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: ringhoffer
Reviews.Content: Entire staff was nice and helpful. Only downsides and they were few are low lighting in bathroom and ice only on even # floors. Staying there four days thats not a lot of problems for a nit picker. Very conveinient to SMU and premeir shopping locations.

Reviews.Title: “My fourth stay and I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: phd2
Reviews.Content: The Palomar Dallas is one of the most comfortable hotels I have stayed in, combining modern luxury, an excellent position, friendly and helpful staff and every facility you could want from pool to spa to free wi-fi and courtesy tea and coffee. This was my fourth stay within a year and I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “My hats off to the staff at the Palomar!”
Reviews.Author: Exec01
Reviews.Content: For the past 3 years we have hosted our annual sales conference, holiday parties and our off site meetings at the Hotel Palomar Dallas. They remain year after year 2nd to none. The hotel decor, cleanliness, banquet staff, and warm welcome we receive is certainly above all others. My hats off to the wonderful staff at Hotel Palomar!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Amzing Rooms, and Impeccable Staff”
Reviews.Author: GloppenGlebenGloben
Reviews.Content: I was in Dallas for a convention and found a wonderful rate for the room and noticed it was within a short drive of the convention center. I have stayed at Kimpton properties before and enjoyed the experience. This was no exception. I accidentally scheduled the two rooms I had (one for a business associate) for one less day than I needed. The staff realized what I did and, although the hotel was booked solid, made accommodations for me to keep my two rooms an additional day. The flexibility and understanding shown by Michael F. and Josh F. to work this situation out was much appreciated. If I return to Dallas I will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “From Australia my first overseas trip -I felt so spoilt and special”
Reviews.Author: Ginmic60
Reviews.Content: This was my first overseas trip - coming from Brisbane, Australia to the Dress For Success international Summit conference in Dallas . From the moment I arrived at the front entrance - the door being opened - the barrel of iced water bottles, the jugs of blueberry waters, I felt special. It was all the little attentions to detail that made such a difference. I loved the room, the decor. My first experience with room service- having a cup of tea delivered - the men were so polite. I loved the food and the 214 restaurant- my first taste of american food - YUM! No service was too much trouble for all the staff - so accomodating. Even in the ladies room there were warm towels to dry my hands! I expressed my appreciation to concierges Elroy and Jean Paul and to the receptionists. thank you HOtel Palomar Dallas for making my short stay a wonderful experience. i haven't stopped praising you. My aim is to return to the States - I have the travel bug now! I will certainly be looking at staying at Kimpton hotels when I come. thanks again from an Aussie - Ginny Michel

Reviews.Title: “I love being spoiled at the Kimpton Palomar!”
Reviews.Author: VancouverMuffy
Reviews.Content: Clean, elegant, modern, with great customer service. The hidden gem is the restaurant. Exceptional food; try the banana pudding, served in a mason jar, topped off with carmelized banana. So tasty! And the shrimp and cayenne devilled eggs. Chef makes tasty meals with regional and organic produce. A lovely swimming pool area, with a generous supply of fresh, clean towels. Quiet rooms, good sleeps. There is a running trail very close by. Rapid transit station is right across the street, and it goes into downtown. You need the exact change. Early morning coffee is served in the lobby. Concierge and doorman are just so helpful. I didn't use a vehicle, so can't comment on parking.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I lived here!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: horsetastic
Reviews.Content: This is the most beautiful AND fun hotel I have ever been too. I have been to many 4+ star hotels; however, the Palomar is different. I have stayed here twice this year. They remembered me when I came back! Service is all around top notch! The pool makes you feel like royalty. It's the pool Goldilocks chose.....not too hot or cold. The Jacuzzi the same. Most of the food form the restaurant is great! I highly recommend the Kobe burger! it's incredible! I do not recommend ordering from the extra late night menu. It's just not all that. Even though there are some inconsistencies with the kitchen, it's still delicious food. The hotel and grounds are beautifully kept, pet friendly and a speedy valet service. The Valet (Josh?) even retrieved my forgotten phone from my car, when I was too tired to leave the building. The only thing I wish that they could change is, guest parking. My friend would not hear of paying for parking to spend an hour visiting me at the hotel. As a result, she almost got towed (she parked in the back gravel lot). This hotel is a great place to just get away from it all. It's FANTASTIC!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and AMAZING customer service. Customer for life!”
Reviews.Author: canis2002
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked an overnight stay at the Palomar for a quick getaway. We were able to check into the hotel early and enjoyed several hours poolside before our sitter called to say that she had a family emergency. When I went to the front desk to check-out (only 5 hours after checking in) and explained why we couldn't stay overnight, THEY COMPLETELY REFUNDED THE ROOM CHARGES! I will stay at the Palomar every time we're in Dallas! Thanks for the amazing customer service! Can't wait to reschedule our getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Anniversary Getaway”
Reviews.Author: ginag2424
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to stay at the Hotel Palomar for our anniversary getaway weekend.
