We traveled from Oklahoma, and being new to the area we had no one to watch our dogs, so it was necessary we traveled with them. I highly recommend any Kimpton hotel for anyone traveling with pets. Their pet policy can't be beat- no additional fee, no weight or breed restrictions, and they offer beds and bowls if you forgot them. We were delightfully surprised with a complimentary bottle of champagne and strawberries to kick off our anniversary celebration, and the room was lovely. Room service was prompt and the meal (breakfast) was delicious. Everyone was very accommodating and pleasant, especially the lady at the hotel bar, who was funny and very knowledgeable about Dallas and what the city has to offer. We also took advantage of the military rate- one of the most significantly discounted offers we've taken advantage of. It's nice to know Kimpton appreciates the military. This is our third stay at a Kimpton hotel (we've been to Hotel Monaco in Seattle and Chicago) and each hotel had a different aesthetic, but they all have had exceptional customer service in common. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palomar's Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Jpedward
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff Excellent little extras Excellent service Excellent hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business or with your family”
Reviews.Author: parisbound11
Reviews.Content: This is primarily a nice hotel, catering to business travelers. There were plenty of wedding parties as well. I traveled here with my child, and was happy to say they catered well to children. Child breakfast was free. Free goldfish for your room. The concierge hooked up my son with a cowboy hat, sheriff's badge, bandana, and chocolate bars for him to wear to the rodeo. The pool is awesome. I would stay here happily for business as well. Nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and were sorry to leave.”
Reviews.Author: cplongley
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful hotel with the most courteous and helpful staff, especially the concierge, Eloy. He went out of his way to help make our stay special from picking out the perfect Tex-Mex restaurant, Alma, to getting us to SMU on time. As first time visitors to Dallas, the Palomar was a true surprise and one of the most unique hotels we've ever stayed in. Great lap pool and iced teas in the lobby, very good restaurant, too. It's trendy and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Weekend in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: EBF630
Reviews.Content: I needed to be in a central location on this trip to Dallas, and Hotel Palomar fit the bill. It was by far, the best hotel experience I've had in a long time. From the moment you drive up and are greeted by the ever efficient and friendly valet crew, you know you're in for a treat. Check-in was seamless, and as an "in Touch" member - I was pleasantly rewarded with a mini bar credit. The room was contemporary excellence. I also had the opportunity to dine at Central 214, and breakfast was decadent. The staff at the hotel all seem very eager to go out of their way to accomodate. Lucky for me, my travels bring me back to Dallas in July. I can already taste the Vanilla Cinammon Belgian Waffle. EBF

Reviews.Title: “Fun stay in crisp, clean and contemporary Palomar in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: keeling_london
Reviews.Content: I visited Dallas for a couple of days on business and had the pleasure of staying at the Kimpton. This was my second stay at a Kimpton, and I was even more impressed than with the first in San Francisco. The Palomar in Dallas looks to be in a very new building, and it has all the Kimpton touches - interesting contemporary furnishings, pet friendly, wine reception in the evenings and coffee service in the mornings. It also has a great restaurant - I'm not usually a fan of hotel restaurants but had a very enjoyable meal at the 214 with some colleagues. The most pleasant surprise for me was the Exhale spa. Both mornings I was at the hotel I went to a class at the spa - yoga on one day and a core class on the other. There is an extra charge for the classes but they are fantastic quality in beautiful facilities so I had absolutely no objection to paying. Finally, the Palomar is located very close to a few casual restaurants, so if you're not driving like me and want something relaxed, you can literally walk across the street for a meal or some supplies. I'm looking forward to returning to the Palomar when I'm next in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Oasis in the City”
Reviews.Author: BobLDallas_TX
Reviews.Content: We spent an anniversary weekend away from home in the city. Everything about the hotel was great, front desk, valet, maid service, restaurant service - all of it. Brunch and dinner at Central 214 were great too. The whole experience had a resort feel, even though it's in the middle of the city. The public area are a chic 60's modern. Loved the open stairway. I have already recommended this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Fabulous Staff”
Reviews.Author: poorokie
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute "truly we were on the outskirts of Dallas" gem of a find. Four of us were coming into town for a weekend of shopping at Market. We like to alll stay together (so we can talk all night) sometimes it is a problem to find a room large enough without booking a suite. We booked through hotwire. One room, 2 beds :we were thrilled. When we saw the Palomar the giggles began. It is exquisitely decorated, and the staff is wonderful. The room was Huge! Location truly is everything and the Palomar was only minutes away from all the places we wanted to go to. Thanks for a wonderful and sucessful weekend of shopping with the girls.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another well-deserved 5 star review for the Palomar!!!”
Reviews.Author: palominogrigo
Reviews.Content: We were towing an antique wooden boat from Houston to Dallas for a festival on a lake and had made reservations to stay at the Palomar. Little did we know-our boat would also be spending the night at the Palomar (due to a mishap on the highway that prevented us from launching the boat that evening). Over the phone it was determined that the boat would not be able to fit in the Palomar's garage; so Mike and the team at the Palomar immediately came up with a inventive and great solution-they could not have been more helpful, accommodating, or delightful. This is truly a special hotel that radiates good karma! It is also a pet friendly hotel, which is spotlessly clean and does not smell of dogs or cats. In fact, I did not even see a pet hair on the carpets! I honestly do not know how the Palomar manages to accomlish all that, but it is a magic formula. The boat, the dog, my husband and I, all, had a splendid stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: MartyHuntsville
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Dallas at the first of June and reserved the room off of Snique Away website. The rooms were nice and the hotel was nice as well. It was a great location for SMU and not far from Highland Park and the malls and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love Hotel Palomar”
Reviews.Author: jennyeys
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I have stayed at the Hotel Palomar and I love it. We got a suite this time and it was great! It is a great location and the service is wonderful. Who can beat wine at 5, being able to bring you 4 legged friends and getting a goldfish to keep you company.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! Priceline, once again, to the rescue!”
Reviews.Author: AggieGolfer
Reviews.Content: Had to be in town for a marriage and my parents would be coming. My parents are 75 & 73 and so I wanted them to really enjoy their stay. And boy did they! We got two rooms and they were awesome. The staff were more than friendly and the accommodations were 4 star all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jensnoopb
Reviews.Content: I always choose either Kimpton hotels or Hilton hotels when I travel and I was not disappointed! The staff were excellent, the sangria was amazing (at the free wine hour) and the overall feel was very chic. Since I am an intouch member, I received little extras from the staff and they were all appreciated. The turndown service at night (mood lighting, a bottle of water at the bed and the TV on a favorite channel - a preference that I listed on my membership) was a nice touch! If I am in Dallas again I will request this same hotel. I recommended it to my co-workers and they all enjoyed it as well. Thanks Kimpton! So far I have enjoyed your hotels in DC and Chicago. I hope to go to many more!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Property, Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: RGVcritic
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be the Hilton and it was beyond terrible. The Kimpton group has turned this around and its a winner. Reasonably priced and central to everything you need in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Amazed that this was on Priceline.”
Reviews.Author: dkatiemom
Reviews.Content: My husband's birthday was fast approaching, and with an offer from my mother to babysit the children, I turned to Priceline in the hopes of finding a great hotel for a low price. I was absolutely amazed when the Palomar accepted our bid! Fast forward to the day we arrived. Several valets were at attention and one came to the car in seconds with a smile and greeting. An eager and friendly Jean Paul rushed to greet us inside the beautiful lobby and asked to help me with our luggage. Our front desk attendant was Michael Frankel, and although I was worried about the "Priceline stigma", he was discreet and upgraded our room upon request for free (I believe this is based upon availability). We took our keys, turned back for our luggage but it had already been placed on a cart and Kaye (sp?) was extremely friendly and followed us to our room to assist with the luggage. Let me tell you, we felt like rock stars! We had been expecting the smaller, deluxe King room, and now had a corner window seating area with a great view, plenty of square footage, and decor to die for. When Kaye left, we actually did a happy dance at our good fortune! The hotel is nonsmoking, but there are two smoking areas (that we know of), one by the pool on a different floor than the lobby (the pool was closed for maintenance while we were there and so these doors were locked, but keep in mind if you want to slip quietly out for a smoke, you can do this without going though the lobby and being "seen", so it would feel more private.) The other smoking area is located outside of the hotel in the front valet area, is very nicely appointed (think huge, lit candles, fluffed cushions and high-backed, private seating areas), and it was very relaxing to sit, watch the activity, take part in conversations and meet some wonderful people, to boot. For the non-smokers, rest assured, this does NOT interfere in any way with the hotel and will not affect your stay at the least. I think the design was carefully planned for this reason. The room service menu was to die for, including Chicken and waffles, and some slightly risque "naughty" sides that sounded absolutely sinful and scrumptious. Options like the Kobe burger and ribs were, I believe, also offered on the late night menu and surprisingly affordable for those (like us!) who are tired of the same old salad or club sandwich late-night staples. The bedding was heaven. Don't expect to wake up, unless you set the alarm. Oh, and about the alarm clock. When we arrived, the soothing sounds of the ocean filled the room. There is something special about a place that offers little details such as this. The next day, we shyly called the guest services line and asked about a late checkout, knowing that we had already received a bargain. They gladly extended the time by an hour and it was just enough to finish our movie, take our showers and get packed to go home. When we left the hotel, the valet wearing the hat brought us complimentary waters while we waited for our car. In short, it was an amazing experience. We LOVED it. Priceline or not, we WILL be back. :)

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch concierge at outstanding hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ChiChocGirl
Reviews.Content: Concierge Eloy is a wizard! He had spot-on recommendations to round out my trip, on everything from delicious local chocolate, to which malls would have what I was looking for, to the best authentic Mexico City-style fish tacos. The entire staff were friendly and all-round wonderful, and the decor was lovely: contemporary soothing-Southwestern. You can't go wrong at any Kimpton property, and Eloy and the Palomar Dallas are definitely first-rate.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: aladyhoneyb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at his hotel for our Anniversary. The hotel staff were friendly. The room was contemporary and clean. We really liked being close to shopping, a movie theater and wonderful restaurants. We also enjoyed the free WiFi. I must say that this was a pleasant experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Place to Spend a Wedding Anniversary!!!”
Reviews.Author: FWM26
Reviews.Content: As a surprise, I selected the Hotel Palomar as the place to spend a romantic weekend with my wife to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary. We had stayed at the Hilton (the property that preceded the Palomar) on our wedding night, so the memories of the location were very special to us. Though I had several ideas to make the weekend special, Konni Godley and the concierge staff (Karena, JonPaul and Eloy) went the extra mile to design in some unique features (rose petals on the bed in the shape of a heart, candles around the spa tub, champagne and truffles, massages at the adjoining Exhale spa, etc.). Needless to say, my wife was totally blown away! The hotel staff was very attentive to our needs and genuinely enjoyed being a part of our celebration. The valets called us by name (Mike was especially helpful) and the front desk personnel (kudos to Michael, who helped me select the best room for our needs, and to Rachel and Jordan) were all smiles. We breakfasted at the Central 214 restaurant and had a nice relaxing meal. The Palomar is well located for an easy walk to SMU (our alma mater) or to Mockingbird Station where you can then train to North Park Mall or to downtown Dallas. We truly enjoyed our stay and highly recommend the Hotel Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: PrincessNthePea
Reviews.Content: This is a highly rated hotel, but have to confess based on the ratings, we expected more. On the plus side, service was nice, and the happy hour in the lobby in the evening was very pleasant. The downside - the beautiful infinity pool and spa on the 2nd floor (outdoors) was completely ruined by the very loud generator noise coming from a neighboring business. In addition, the said generator also created an overwhelming diesel smell that couldn't be escaped. The pool was one of the reasons we chose this hotel. The room was nicely decorated. I was dismayed to discover that the shower head flopped around and in obvious need of repair, not to mention dismal water pressure the first day we were there (better the second day). Also not wild about the 2 very long hairs I found in the bathroom - one elegantly draped across the toilet seat! Not what I was expecting from what was supposed to be a first rate hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Pet Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: britbrat2001
Reviews.Content: I have been to some very good "pet friendly" hotels but this one was unbelievable! While we were treated very well, my dog was doted on, catered to, and allowed pretty much anywhere we went except in the swimming pool--which is okay because she doesn't swim :-). The facility is lovely and relaxing, the rooms clean and well appointed, and the restaurant was delicious--try the chef tasting menu. Most importantly, I have NEVER encountered a more gracious, accommodating, and friendly staff. Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, pet friendly, excellent location, excellent service, restaurant food is outstanding”
Reviews.Author: jhmme
Reviews.Content: This is my first choice for any stay in Dallas for both business and personal trips. Excellent location. The hotel is pet friendly and it is stress free and delightful to have your pet with you and have such wonderful, caring service toward your pet. There is no parking so you must valet your car. Spa and restaurant are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Hip, Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ttouchstone
Reviews.Content: Very impressed from the start. Cool lobby, great service. Rooms are very cool. Pool was very crowded, but we managed to find a few chairs anyway. Bar at the Pool needs a little more to it, but it did the job.

Reviews.Title: “I'm a Palomar convert following our stay here.”
Reviews.Author: willtravl13
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some special touches that really set it apart from other nice hotels. Walking into the lobby from the withering Dallas heat to pitchers of ice cold water with raspberries or blueberries sets you in a good frame before you ever see your room. Many hotels offer morning coffee in the lobby but this one goes the extra distance to add individually wrapped mint lifesavers so you don't subject your friends and fellow travelers to coffee breath! These are just two examples of the great personalized experience you have at this nicely appointed well located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Rose58277
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Palomar Hotel and I must say it was one of our best hotel stays. The service was impeccable and we loved partaking in the wine hour in the evening. We will definitely choose this hotel when we return to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: globurson
Reviews.Content: I just recently celebrated a special occasion at Hotel Palomar and everything about the stay exceeded my expectations. The hotel, spa and restaurant were all a treat, and we experienced lovely service from all of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly, Exceptional environment and amenities.”
Reviews.Author: JohnCalvin84
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised with how contemporary the furniture and amenities were. The pool and Hot-tub are a must to visit! I had a blast! I have never experienced a hotel that surprised me this much in just one visit! -John Calvin

Reviews.Title: “Like coming home, only better!”
Reviews.Author: Tessnika
Reviews.Content: Extraordinary staff and delightful ambiance. We love the cabanas at the pool and the outside dining areas. Lovely food.

Reviews.Title: “sheer perfection”
Reviews.Author: wineaux713
Reviews.Content: couldn't have asked for a better stay! greeted by name at every step of the way. the room was expertly decorated and perfectly accommodating. room service was delivered in record time...what else can i say? oh, excellent people watching from the wedding saturday night!

Reviews.Title: “Yee haw.”
Reviews.Author: lyoungny
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the Hotel Palomar. Nice room, excellent staff and perfect location to visit SMU. I took one of the most exhilarating yoga class of my life at Exhale Spa. The wine hour in the lobby was a huge hit with my group. Yummy snacks. Simon, the chef at the hotel restaurant, personally greeted my group, hung out with us and sent some yummy desserts for us to sample.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place in Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: GoinCruizin2008
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel! The service is outstanding, from the wonderful welcome you receive from the valet's (every time you pull up in your car, they welcome you back!), the friendly front desk, that is super efficient, quick check-in, (stayed here 5 times and never had to wait in a line) and always happy to answer questions. The room service is very fast, food great and the server super cheerful and even made recommendations for breakfast. The decor is fabulous, beds comfy, love the turn down service, excellent wifi, pool and jacuzzi so relaxing with pool side service very prompt. Love the late night martini's and appetizers! Could go on and on, just feel pampered and spoiled every visit. The only place to stay in Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “These folks are so NICE! Thank you!”
Reviews.Author: gracekelly2112
Reviews.Content: I am one of those people that only reviews if the experience is bad or REALLY good. They are awesome. Went out of the way to be friendly and helpful. I was there for the Dallas Rock n roll half marathon. Easy to get to race w/ DART across street.. The hotel had coffee and breakfast items for free for all their runners headed out to the race. I even ran into use the restroom during race and they didn't look at me funny. were cool with late checkout. THANk YOU!

Reviews.Title: “An Exceptional Lodging Experience with Everything Done to Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: MisterJamesBond
Reviews.Content: I travel to Dallas on business about once a month on average and unless it is sold out, I always stay at the Hotel Palomar. The property excels in every category. At the outset, the staff throughout the property is professional, thoughtful and caring. The high level of service starts with the bell personnel - whom are guided by Billy and Michael -who come to assist me as I get out of my taxi. It continues at the front desk where I am greeted by a warm and friendly member of Front Office Manager Jerry Lui's fine staff. The lead concierge JonPaul Barnes ensures that all my special requests (chilled wine, extra towels, etc.) are accommodated so that everything is just right when I walk into my room. Housekeeping does a nice job of servicing the room (while one would expect that it is a given that a room will be cleaned well, that is not always the case, even in the classiest of hotels). As to the room, I typically stay in a Grand Luxury Suite, which is spacious and well appointed. The bed and its linens are very comfortable, the iPod clock on the night table allows me to play my own music, the bathroom is huge, the deep jacuzzi type tub seats two and the separate living area has a comfortable sofa and an excellent work area that has plenty of power outlets. The hotel is situated at the busy intersection of Northcentral Expressway and Mockingbird Lane, but the heavy duty windows keep any traffic noise out such that the rooms are quiet and peaceful. (Also, at times that the Grand Luxury Suites have been unavailable I have stayed in regular rooms . . . while they are not as large, all the excellent features associated with the Grand Luxury Suites are found in these other rooms.) The hotel also affords a wonderful dining and bar experience. Chef Blythe Beck of Central 214 - the cool restaurant on the property - turns out creative and extremely tasty dishes that are loaded with butter and calories, which is not necessarily a bad thing (the well equipped gym on the second floor or the hotel - it's got LifeFitness cardio machines and a more than adequate set of weight machines and set of free weights - is there to work off the calories). The servers in the restaurant and the bar staff (including Dave and Gabby) are friendly and attentive. The food that is served in Central 214 can be delivered to one's room through Inroom Dining, which features prompt and professional service. The hotel also features the spa Exhale. I have had some excellent massages and pedicures through through this spa, which were nice treats. Also, the hotel has a large heated outdoor pool that is surrounded by plenty of comfortable lounge chairs, whcih is a nice place to hang out on a warm sunny afternoon. The hotel is located just across from the SMU campus and Mockingbird Station. It is conveniently located to the downtown business district (which is a roughly ten minute taxi ride during the morning rush hour) and there are plenty of good bars and restaurants in the area that are either within walking distance or a short taxi ride away. Love Field is about 15 to 20 minutes away and DFW is around a 35 minute ride from the hotel. In conclusion, the Hotel Palomar is great! I am a regular customer so I likely get extra special treatment, yet I observe the staff treat all other guests in a conscientous and professional manner, so I think that I would provide a similarly stellar review even if I had visited the propoerty just once (actuallly, when I first stayed at the hotel three years ago, my experence then was as good as the experiences that I have now). Stay at the Hotel Palomar . . . you will be happy that you did!

Reviews.Title: “You could pay more for 5 star service, but why when you can stay at the Palomar?”
Reviews.Author: dd166
Reviews.Content: We stay here every time we come to Dallas (which is frequently with an SMU student in the family). We hit all of the top end favorites (Ritz, Mansion at Turtle Creek, Crescent) before we discovered the Palomar and now are disappointed if the Palomar is sold out and we have to go to one of the previously mentioned alternatives. Can't be beat on value, service (tops) and location.

Reviews.Title: “The Conceierge was AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: matthewlebaron
Reviews.Content: I recently spent the week at the Palomar Dallas for a work trip. The absolute best part was Kareena Rosillo, the Concierge. She was helpful, sweet, always had a smile on her face and not once said "no" off the bat. She even managed to get my an ice pack on the fly from her kitchen, within minutes. She is resourceful as all get out. Honestly, the rooms are great, and the hotel itself is very clean, comfortable and well designed. The beds are very comfy and the bathroom is really perfect for that home away from home feeling. The internet should be free for the money you pay here. I mean, its just price gauging at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “A refined oasis in the midst of the city shuffle”
Reviews.Author: David P
Reviews.Content: I was going to be in Dallas for under 24 hours, landing one eveing and with a very busy day before departing the next afternoon. I needed a hotel where I could relax and wake fully rested, without being too far from my destinations in Oak Lawn and UT Southwestern Medical Center; and the Hotel Palomar was a much better option than anything near Stemmons Freeway. The front desk staff was warm and welcoming. Gabrielle at the bar help me feel at home with beer and food suggestions, and the room was, at once, spacious and cozy. Whenever I return to Dallas, Hotel Palomar will be at the top of my list!

Reviews.Title: “Just Superb!”
Reviews.Author: hmh52
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in the heart of Dallas. The service, food and people are just superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere and pool area”
Reviews.Author: bettyc33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while on a short wknd trip to Dallas to celebrate my birthday. The reception area is really chic and modern. They had refreshing water with lemon at check-in. We arrived right at 5pm and were able to enjoy the complimentary wine being served downstairs. We paid for valet, but my sister parked across the street in a garage without any problems for free. It is a pet friendly hotel, which wasn't a plus for me since I'm not an animal lover. I was concerned the room would smell funny, but it didn't at all. They also met my request for a goldfish in the room (just for fun!) The room also had an ipod radio, so didn't have to pack mine. The next morning we enjoyed the pool, even though it was a bit chilly. It's a small area, so I'm sure it gets packed during summer time. They also have a bar up there, but it wasn't open during the off season. I don't know if they charge for the cabana use during summer, but they looked really comfortable. We didn't eat at the restaurant or use the spa, but I did order a bloody mary one morning and it was pretty pricey ($10) but that's to be expected from a hotel bar, I guess. Overall, I thought the hotel was really clean and modern. Would def stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I'm coming back!”
Reviews.Author: MrsKurtz
Reviews.Content: This hotel had fabulous food, facilities, and service. I enjoyed the heated pool in the evening as well as the wine hour. The concierge was very helpful in recommending restaurants as well as making reservations. The hotel also had a remarkable restaurant called Central 214 and the food was delicious. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home - even better!”
Reviews.Author: anonymous13465
Reviews.Content: I've been a frequent guest of the Hotel Palomar Dallas since they opened several years ago and wouldn't stay anywhere else. From the Valet & Bell Staff, through Front Desk, Concierge, Room Service, Central 214, Housekeeping, Maintenance and Management and everywhere in between, guests are made to feel as though they have just arrived "home". This property is beautifully detailed...Simple and elegant, yet comfortable and sophisticated... They are pet-friendly - and you can even request a pet goldfish in your room for companionship! (Even though they are pet-friendly, i've never been disturbed by as much as a bark or a whimper while in my room or even in the lobby!) Guests are treated like family and are warmly welcomed by the entire staff, but are still offered plenty of privacy. You can be confident knowing family, friends or clients will receive impeccable service and will enjoy their stay. Rooms are exceptionally comfortable, beautifully decorated and work-friendly. Pool is stunning! Workout facility is excellent and Exhale Spa is attached to the hotel. Central 214 offers unbelievable dining experience with a wide variety to suite even the most discerning diner, wonderful wines, and amazing staff - nothing like typical hotel restaurants. Definitely a spot to book a meal or cocktails in Dallas - even if you're not staying at the Hotel Palomar. With everything under one roof, there's no reason to leave (which was perfect for the recent "snow days" in Dallas). But, should you decide to venture out, Hotel Palomar is in a perfect location - across from Mockingbird Station/SMU...shopping, campus, restaurants, even dry cleaning, pharmacy, and shoe repair all within walking distance. Second to none

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: beth0602
Reviews.Content: My husband was home on leave from Iraq, and we chose the Hotel Palomar because they were pet friendly. They were amazing, the best service I have ever received at any hotel. Our room had a dog bed, bottled water, dog dish, and dog biscuits waiting for our Lab. The hotel is gorgeous, and everyone was amazing, from the bellhops, maids, front desk, and especially the concierge Jon Paul, who did everything possible to ensure that my husband had a good stay at the hotel before having to go back to Iraq. I have stayed at a lot of hotels, in many places, but the treatment you receive at the Hotel Palomar is so above and beyond anything I have experienced that I would recommend this hotel to anyone, the fact that they are pet friendly is just a huge plus. The first thing my husband wants to do when he gets back is go stay at this hotel again!! Thank you all for making my husbands leave so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with Fur Babies!!!”
Reviews.Author: TXRedhead86
Reviews.Content: Love this pet friendly hotel in Dallas. We had a business conference nearby, so hubby and I decided to stay over so we wouldn't have to commute over an hour every morning. We chose the Palomar since we wanted to bring our two little Shih Tzus with us instead of shipping them off to the doggie spa. The hotel is beautiful, the staff is wonderful and they're the best pet friendly place we've ever stayed. They even have a pet chef if you want to spoil your puppies with some freshly prepared food. Lots of grassy areas to walk your dog & you can arrange for staff to walk your pets several times a day for a fee. Very happy with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “It takes a lot to get 5 stars out of me”
Reviews.Author: kellynch
Reviews.Content: But the Hotel Palomar earned it! This ultra pet friendly hotel is heavy on style and service. The staff goes out of it's way to make sure you and your pet have everything you could possibly need and the price a very reasonable. They have a lovely coffee, tea and chai bar in the morning, Hot chocolate bar in the afternoon and wine and snacks in the evening, all complimentary. I joined the kimpton rewards program online and made my reservations online where I could put in my preferences, so when I got to my room, there was a dog bed, water, dog treats, yoga kit, gold fish (to keep my dog company), my choice of newspaper etc. The little extra touchs go on and on. The gym was lovely as was the pool. I didn't eat in the restruant, but it looked nice.

Reviews.Title: “Family reunion”
Reviews.Author: Fernhart
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with tons of amenities. Fabulous pool and bar. Didn't get to eat at the restaurant, but the food looked lovely. Very attentive staff and the location can't be beat! We were there to visit the entire family and stayed there because my sister in law lives at the Residence at the Hotel Palomar. We had our little ones with us and they thoroughly enjoyed the pool. It smells like roses throughout the entire place, not like a spay, but like real roses!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: GoArmyFootball
Reviews.Content: First, the Concierge knew what he was talking about. His restaurant recommendations where right on. They have a complimentary wine hour from 5 to 6. The wine they served was fabulous and they had sample appetizers from the restaurant. One night they served lamb sliders with a special sauce. It was delicious. The door man who greeted us was terrific. They have dog bowls at the entrance. They have a chalk board with the names of the guest dogs written. The lobby was elegant. Even the guest dogs looked elegant. There were free copies of the New York Times, the Wall Street Journal and the standard USA Today in the lobby. There was round the clock gourmet coffee service too. The rooms were just as depicted in the web site photos. The beds were incredible. The rooms were spotless. The pillows on our bed ranged from thick and fluffy to flatter and soft. I am a side sleeper so the pillow selection suited me fine. The only negative was the water pressure in the shower could have been stronger. We will definitely look for other hotels in this chain. Oh, yes: the sheets were terrific I plan to buy a set for our bed at home.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Fermina22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the rooms spacious; they also offer a sort of stand-by room upgrade for as little as $5 more per night. We had lunch and breakfast in the restaurant (214), and the food was fab! Check in was a breeze, the service was great (they sent us a survey after our stay, which to me is important), wi-fi worked pretty well...the only complaint (if you want to call it that), it that the hotel does not offer a self-parking option, nor would they let me keep my car keys. Other than that, we loved it...it's in a great location to see the best of Dallas. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Jumping Place, Trendy Design, Can't get in the pool with Scenesters”
Reviews.Author: InAustin
Reviews.Content: Cute room (small) with a nice design, sweet afternoon tea and good location. Restaurant - food very good and courtyard was lovely. Fast, hip crowd at pool so couldn't get near it or the pool bar. Just to much posing. Front desk staff was very nice even for being so busy. We had a great view of the night sky from the room and the room was quiet (even though there were 5 wedding parties in the building.) Concierge sent us to a perfect indian restaurant. I think Palomar is now our Dallas getaway - plus it's a straight shot over to the King Spa. Yay!

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, small rooms, noisy neighbors”
Reviews.Author: AngloNorskCanadian5
Reviews.Content: Hotel was easy to find, front desk staff really nice and gave us a discount we didn't really ask for which was good as the rate was high. The room was really small very trendy furnishings we could not work out how to turn on the shower! We were on the 7th floor surprised to find the large window opened fully. We were woken up several times in the night by noisy guests shouting in the corridor but it was a Saturday night and not really the fault of the hotel. There was compulsory valet parking which is a pet hate of ours. We went out for brunch but there was coffee and tea to go in the lobby which was nice. They are also pet friendly which is nice even though we didn't have ours with us. The free internet was a pain you had to join their frequent guest scheme to get it which took forever and felt like an imposition. All in all average except for the friendly check in guy who was great.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lobby, rooms, and staff are all warm and inviting!”
Reviews.Author: endless_summer1966
Reviews.Content: Our entrance through the front door was a pleasant welcome by the door staff, Front desk staff were friendly, Concierge on staff Konni Godley was pleasant, warm, and friendly. She asked us what brought us to the Palomar, I replied, for an Adult time out! She advised of the events that were in the area and on the property. We went out with friends of our to dinner nearby, and was suprised by a bottle of red wine and sweat treats at bedside. The entire hotel welcomes you, either by sight, touch, sound. You have a sense of being very comfortable in your own skin, and with the one you love. Found out through a source of mine that Konni was recently voted "Concierge of the Year" by her fellow concierge's in the Dallas area. What an honor to be served by such a geniune person. When you arrive, don't forget to ask for Konni, she will make you feel like you never left home, which in turn makes you never want to leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just like the other reviewers!”
Reviews.Author: travelclassygal
Reviews.Content: Palomar is located right off N 75,I exited Mockingbird Lane and almost missed it. as it is right off the Freeway....even though it is right off Freeway it was very quiet. Great air conditioning, quiet and personal. Robes are fun. I ordered Room Service twice and it was at my room within 15 minutes...Not cheap, but tasty. I have booked the Palomar in Washington DC for a christmas trip and had decided that depending on how things go in the Dallas Palomar, I may change my decision on Washington, but I will keep my reservation. Good Find!

Reviews.Title: “DIG IT”
Reviews.Author: DraperyDude
Reviews.Content: Different that other hotels you will stay at. Great interior design of the hotel. Converted from a Hyatt. For my business purposes and clients I needed to see it had a great location to the Uptown. I will always stay there if it fits into my budget. Restaurant is excellent although I prefer the breakfast menu versus the dinner menu.

Reviews.Title: “Funky bathrobes!”
Reviews.Author: tomatovine
Reviews.Content: Great friendly service at check in. Didn't have chance to try the bar/restaurant but it did look very inviting! Had 2 fantastic nights sleep-didn't hear a sound all night. I really liked the decor and fun finishing touches in the room-I wish I'd have known you could have a goldfish in the room, if I stay again I would definitely ask for one! The hotel is located across the road from Mockingbird station where there is also a direct bus to Lovefield airport (it takes 30 mins). We arrived at Dallas Fort Worth and took a cab to the hotel, this also takes about 30 mins and cost around $65. If I ever go back to Dallas I would definitely consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversay treat”
Reviews.Author: Britgirl_dallas_72
Reviews.Content: The Palomar hotel is located in the Mockingbird area of Dallas and we chose to celebrate out ten year wedding anniversary here. The rooms are stunning and we both loved the touch of the goldfish (on request) You can actually bring your own pets here too. The room was large and lurorious with a nice modern bathroom (and leopard print bathrobes) I highly recommend the onsite restaurant ( Central 214) which is upscale American foods We didn't use man of the facilities, but the pool is nice with chairs and cabannas The nearby Mockingbird station area has a dart train as well as movie theatre, bars, restaurants and clubs

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable luxurious hotel with a cool vibe”
Reviews.Author: leothelioness
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel over the past weekend. From the moment we walked in the front doors for check-in- had a wonderful experience. The gentlemen at the check in Friday October 8th evening was extremely courteous and professional and personally just very nice and welcoming. The hotel common areas were beautiful. The room was large and well- appointed- lovely contemporary decor, nice large flat screen television. I saw that you could request a pet goldfish in your room, so for laughs I did. It was there waiting in our room when we arrived! Cute! We ordered room service because we were exhausted from attending the TX state fair all day and the food was good- slightly expensive for what we got- but good. We just ordered a simple chicken sandwich and pizza and soup. Comfortable bed and very quiet corner room. The shower's water pressure was very very weak- my only complaint regarding the room. My boyfriend and I both have long hair, so it was a very long shower rinsing out the shampoo/conditioner! We visited the pool and hot tub- very nice area- we lounged on a large sofabed lounger in the cabana area. Not much sun- it could have been the time of day and the shade from the surrounding area building so it was slightly cold. Got some fruity delicious fresh cocktails from the bar downstairs (pool bar was closed on a saturday afternoon- great weather day) and was locked out of the pool area- a hotel employee tried to help but couldn't so had to go back through the hotel the long was around to get back to the pool deck. Free morning coffee was great. A slight screw up on my check out bill but was corrected without any issue. The hotel was very luxurious and comfortable, the service was great and I would definately spend another weekend here! I also attended a fantastic yoga class at the adjoining Exhale Spa. The class was very crowded, the teacher was amazing- a fast pased music flow yoga class on Saturday morning. We had the TX state fair package so got a great room rate with the package and free parking. Overall a wonderful memorable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cwildrose
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar for the first time October 9, in town for the Cowboys game. It was great! Easy check-in, attractive rooms and lobby, hosted wine hour, great bar scene. We only stayed one night, but we would certainly go back. Recommend to anyone. Also, they accept pets which is surprising, but nice. I wish I had time for the spa - maybe next time.

Reviews.Title: “Over-Rated!”
Reviews.Author: TexanAllTheWay
Reviews.Content: This hotel overrates itself by claiming great service; well, we saw none of that. The front desk never told us about services, like coffee in the morning downstairs, location of the pool, the happy hour, etc. The main reason we stayed at the hotel was for the pool. Looks really inviting in the picture, right? Well, it was FREEZING; much colder than Barton Springs in Austin! We couldn't believe it. I guess October is not considered a winter month for heating the pool as stated on their website, and there was no pool-side service as stated on their website. We'll NEVER stay at one of these Kimpton hotels again as we were made to feel very inconsequential.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stefalis
Reviews.Content: Super friendly staff, great location and loads of amenities. Would stay again, and when I do I hope I get to see more dogs - only saw one well behaved boxer during our two night stay :( All the other reviews are right on point about the comfortable and quiet rooms, lack of pet smells, etc. Well worth a visit anytime, for either business or leisure travel.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooners Delight”
Reviews.Author: tripaj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Palomar for our honeymoon. Some thought we were crazy to go to Dallas and stay at a hotel other than "the W" but they were eating their words later. There are two guys who stand out as far as making our experience better. One of the drivers who took us around several times became like our friend for the week, very friendly and nice. The first impression of the hotel however was a guy (Mike?) who helped us get our bags, took us to our room, and made us feel at ease (since hotels.com screwed up our reservation completely, thanks guys). We got an incredible deal through hotels.com BUT next time I'd probably just keep an eye on the Palomar's website because they offered something like 30% off of room rates for an advanced booking. The room was wonderful. Very nice bed, linens on the bed, couch, tv, etc. My wife forgot a curling iron and they were able to provide her with one. I was able to charge my iphone daily with the provided iHome dock. The wifi was free because we signed up with a free service with Kimpton hotels. They delivered strawberries and champagne for free with a note welcoming us to the hotel for our honeymoon. They were able to recommend incredible restaurants and things to do as well as drive us to many of them (within 3 miles of the hotel, for free). The pool was incredible (we spent a lot of time there): An infinity edge pool, free water, restaurant service available, private cabanas with comfy bed/couches, hot tub, great music, and giant towels. Also, daily they had a wine tasting in the lobby and one day they even had an ice cream bar! My wife and I were very blessed to have found such a great deal for our honeymoon. We've been thinking of excuses to go back because if you stay in a Kimpton hotel 10 nights in a year (I believe it was 10) then you get 2 nights free when you sign-up for the free service (that gets you the free wifi as already mentioned). Complaints, there had to be some! Overnight parking: unfortunately $10/night, but necessary. The restaurant in the hotel was insanely priced. It was our honeymoon and we could have splurged on the restaurant, but instead went shopping and bought more stuff. If you have the money, it looked very very nice, but I'm enjoying the coat I bought instead! The same goes for room service. PB&J shouldn't be $15. Lastly, the spa attached to the hotel leads you to believe you will receive a free massage session just for staying at the hotel when in the fine print it says you'll receive a free one with the purchase of like a 2 hour massage. Instead we went to a massage place a few miles down the road and got an hour long couples massage for less than one hour for a single at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than The Best”
Reviews.Author: keejrd
Reviews.Content: Modern customer service expectations are so low that to experience the warmth and support of the staff I felt this past weekend at Hotel Palomar initially felt surreal. This was my experience being greeted by the friendly valet-men and the professional bell-hops. My introduction to Hotel Palomar inspired memories of a time when people treated other people like family, folks had pride in their job, and going the extra mile was "no trouble at all". By the time I made it through the front doors of the hotel, I had a smile on my face, I was relaxed, and I realized that this hotel was special. I stay at Ritz-Carltons, Hiltons, and many other very nice hotels, but Hotel Palomar takes the cake. It appeared that everyone, at every level, understood that the beautiful physical environment at Hotel Palomar would account for nothing if it was not supported by the most important aspect of a hotel, a friendly supporting staff. Upon arrival, the young man at the front desk, Josh, assisted us by giving us a map and describing different parts of town. Throughout our weekend, he assisted us with information on local events we would not have otherwise known about. I called down to the Concierge for a Zagat Rated restaurant that evening. On my way out for the day I was handed a number of different options with more information than I could have ever expected. It was as if the hotel actually cared about making my stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “One of the top hotels in Dallas...unique, modern, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Traveler71
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar is a great stay in Dallas. The hotel is one of our favorites with its phenomenal design, decor, and comfort. The lobby and restaurant space in the hotel are truly beautiful areas.....well designed and inviting. There are many great places inside and outside the ground floor of the hotel to find a nice quiet spot for a drink or to visit with friends or family. The rooms are modern yet very comfortable. The bathrooms, beds, etc. are top quality. The hotel also has a wonderful pool area. It is probably one of the best in Dallas. When staying in the area, it is a toss up between the Hotel Palomar or the Stoneleigh. The Stoneleigh room and general hotel is probably our favorite but it is hard to Palomar wins in the areas of lobby and pool area. Our young kids love looking around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Fab”
Reviews.Author: 3tonkies
Reviews.Content: As an interior designer, I give the Hotel Palomar 5 Stars for an incredible job turning an old Hilton Hotel into a gorgeous, contemporary haven. I can't wait to go back. The hotel is relatively close to Love Field, and North Park Mall. After I was finished with work, I checked out and had them drop me off at North Park (no charge hotel car), checked my bags at the North Park courtesy desk and shopped to my heart's content, then took a quick cab to Love Field. Worked out great. The restaurant, Central 214 was delicious. My favorite was the Key Lime Pie, and warm peach cobbler. Entrees were great too. Kimpton Hotels allow pets, and what a treat to be able to take a pet and not have to stay in a dive. They welcome your pet with a sign in the lobby....too cute. Full service, even for pooch. Next time I plan on trying the spa. My trip was too short to fully experience all the amenities the hotel has to offer, but suffice it to say, I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: werollalong
Reviews.Content: I am somewhat disappointed in the other reviews. I thought I was given special treatment at the Hotel Palomar. It seems like I am. Now, it turns out they treat everyone extremely well! My dogs and I jump in the car and come to the Hotel Palomar every 2-4 months. We make up excuses to come see the good folks at the Hotel Palomar. This visit was no exception -- again the staff went over and beyond what could even reasonably be expected of a hotel staff. In this time of questionable customer service almost everywhere else, the Hotel Palomar knocks the ball out of the park. We love the Hotel Palomar. We love the rooms, the lobby, the amenities, but mostly, how welcome and good they make us feel. Many thanks! See you next time!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palomar - The Best in Texas!!”
Reviews.Author: henryramirez3
Reviews.Content: We had a party and stayed in the unique and beautiful Hotel Palomar last week. To the Staff: Thank you very much for the hospitality we received Friday, Saturday and Sunday. The entire staff was so accommodating and so professional. The manager at Central 214 and the waitress Tatiana (?) were both amazing to all of our guests. Our original plan was to be at the pool bar, but with the temperatures being outrageous the staff at Central 214 was flexible and accommodated our entire party. From the valet, bellhop front desk staff, especially Josh, service was outstanding from start to finish. We did not want to check out. Once we got our party of 30 up to the suite and parlor rooms, we gave them a tour of all of our accommodations. We hope many will be staying in the very near future. The bottle of champagne and berry medley with the personal note was a very nice touch. We thank you sincerely. If you have not experienced Hotel Palomar - You are missing out!

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: KP_vs_theworld
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. Outstanding service! Food from restaurant is top notch and the room service prompt. I asked our bellhop a few questions about local restaurants, he said he would return shortly. 5 min later he as at the door with printed menus of local places to eat with directions from the hotel. Very Impressive. I highly recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a nice hotel in the DFW area.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed July 22-23 for sweetie's...”
Reviews.Author: TimTheTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed July 22-23 for sweetie's birthday and the Lady Gaga show. We are more impressed with this hotel every time we stay. Big, beautiful, comfy rooms. Great location. Fantastic staff! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite stay; wonderful hospitality, welcome, service, and attention”
Reviews.Author: cyclistedc
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Dallas over the 4 July holiday for a birthday getaway with my partner and extended family. Familiar with and a fan of the Kimpton brand, I decided to stay at the Palomar, and couldn't be more pleased with the experience. My partner and I booked a suite, which was spacious and comfortable - if not a bit sparse in the living room area. The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom - with separate shower and jacuzzi soaking tub - was excellent. More than the room and overall decor/feel of the hotel, I was most impressed with and pleased by the welcome and attention from the staff. I have to especially commend the concierge, Eloy Calvo. He helped my partner make various arrangements for my birthday, and ensured we had a superb experience at Charlie Palmer (at another Dallas hotel) for dinner. Always pleasant and smiling, he really embodied a spirit of hospitality. Other members of the reception staff and valet service were also incredibly helpful and attentive. I recommend Exhale, the attached spa, where my partner and I spent a relaxing saturday afternoon of pampering. Only ate breakfast at Central 214, and while pleasant, I was somewhat disappointed with the biscuits and gravy I ordered one morning. The french toast was good, and the fruit plate was well presented with a nice variety. Definitely recommend the hotel for a visit to the Big D.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, central”
Reviews.Author: andrewt333
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ideally located on Mockingbird which is a great place to visit in Dallas. There was a Starbucks right across the road with plenty of choices of places to eat. Therefore, location was ideal. The rooms were spacious, very clean, and roomy. The TV was really nice as well! Service from the staff were nice, helpful and receptive. I would recommend this to anyone visiting Dallas, hands down!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: galveston_gal
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate of $109 on hotels.com so that made our stay even sweeter. We checked in, got our Arnold Palmers (half tea, half lemonade with fresh mint), and headed up to our room. Everything was clean and in good working order. I loved the bedside lamp that only needed to be touched to work. The linens were very nice and the bed comfortable. One minor gripe - no free movie channels - not even HBO. Our room overlooked the roof and pool area. We didn't swim, but it looked like people were enjoying theirselves. At the 5:00 p.m. wine tasting I tried the sangria. It was white rather than the more traditional red, and was not sweet at all. There was also a hot hors doeurve served. Another small gripe is that there is no coffee maker in the room. This means you have to dress and head to the lobby before having that first cup of coffee, which I would prefer not to do. Overall, it is a lovely hotel. The common areas are chic and comfortable. The room is fabulous. I think anyone would like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palomar Dallas exceeded all expectations!”
Reviews.Author: 4545bboop
Reviews.Content: Wow! You hear about hotels with great service and impeccable amenities and they rarely meet expectations. Our recent stay at Hotel Palomar Dallas exceeded our expectations. A lot of hotels promote being "pet friendly" but Hotel Palomar actually is...from valet check-in to delivering a a comfy dog bed and bowls for food and water, we had one spoiled dachshund on our hands. The staff in every area of the hotel was incredible and friendly. We checked out every part of this hotel - the fabulous pool & cabana, the outdoor patio with fireplaces, the hip bar area, the award winning Central 214 restaurant, the spa exhale, and the hotel gym.....all fantastic! Best of all was retiring to our room at night to sleep in a heavenly bed. Kimpton Hotels always are impressive but I have to say, this one exceeded even my expectations. Whether traveling for business or pleasure, you cannot go wrong booking a stay at Hotel Palomar Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Dog Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: huskiesmom
Reviews.Content: I heard about this Hotel from a friend. She told me I should take my dog because it is dog friendly. Well, I did. And this hotel is awesome! It is beautiful, has a wine social in the lobby, lovely pool area, and my dog Holly ( a 43 lb husky) was treated like a VIP! They even allowed me to stay in one of the suites with her. She had a bed, bowls, bottle water and treats waiting for her in the room. Thank you Palomar, for making us feel so welcomed! I will spread the word about your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palomar how do I love thee, let me count the ways...”
Reviews.Author: JovanV
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip thru Dallas, and stayed for the first time at the Hotel Palomar and must say that it was the HIGHLIGHT of our trip!!! Although we did not have our puppy with us, we plan on returning and bringing her along next time. In the meantime, we can now bring her to dinner with us at the local Kimpton property here in Scottsdale, Arizona. Coincidentally, we recently attended a wedding at the FireSky Resort in Scottsdale and never realized this was the very same chain of Kimpton properties. So back to our love affair with the Palomar, here are just a few of the many reasons why we loved staying here: 1) Nightly welcome reception with complimentary drinks and appetizers. (during our stay they served a refreshing white sangria, chardonnay and a great red wine with the most delicious deviled eggs with shrimp) 2) Super friendly staff who cannot do enough for you! 3) the ULTIMATE BENCHMARK in pet friendly hotel properties, we loved meeting some of the interesting guests along with their well behaved pets during the cocktail reception. WARNING: If you don't have a dog, you'll want one after staying here! 4) Plush towels ~ in fact I would say that their towels should win an award for best hotel towel in America. 5) Comfy bathrobes 6) Bathroom Menu of various things one often forgets, so if you forgot to pack your toothbrush, etc., they offer everything at a super low price, (2.00 average) so not only are they super thoughtful, but the hotel is not trying to rip you off on these amenities. 7) L'Occitane shampoo - conditioner - soaps - body lotion 8) Magnifying mirror 9) Adjustable gooseneck bedside reading lamps 10) the most comfortable sheets I have ever slept on~under~between 11) the most amazing mattress, we hated to get up to leave our room 12) Large Flat Screen television 13) On site spa and salon 14) FABULOUS restaurant - don't miss their dessert menu!!! (shout out to our lovely server "Medley" who recommended the chocolate fudge waffle, with caramelized bananas and peanut butter ice cream. ~ WOW, I am still thinking of that dessert days later...LOVED IT. 15) Large rooms - you will have plenty of room to move around in their standard room, without paying for an upgrade. WHY DOESN'T EVERY HOTEL GIVE YOU ROOM IN YOUR ROOM??? They all need to take lessons from Kimpton. 16) Beautiful pool area and hot tub 17) Dog run with large grassy play area 18) SUPER QUIET hallways and rooms ~ NO PET SOUNDS or smells could be detected anywhere on the property, which is an amazing feat in itself. I guess all the dog guests are on their best behavior ~ they know how lucky they are! 19) FREE WI-FI in your room 20) Need I go on...? This place is so wonderful, we cannot wait to return with our little dog Lucy. And all these great amenities are at no extra charge, and they don't even charge a pet fee. We have stayed in various hotels where there is always a pet fee, usually 30.00+ per night, and you must have your dog with you at all times. Here if you want to go out, they will even watch your pet for you, walk your pet, etc...UNBELIEVABLE SERVICE with a smile. We paid a low nightly room rate, but I won't mention the rate in this review...as no matter what you end up paying, it is well worth ANY price to stay here!!! PS) they even have a website dedicated to their fabulous amenities, it seems I am not the only one who wanted to purchase the bed linens. check out: KimptonStyle . com By the way, you might read this review and think I am associated in some way with this hotel chain, I assure you I am NOT. My husband and I were just so thrilled to discover this hotel on Trip Advisor (THANK YOU, Trip Advisor!) that I wanted to write an indepth review so that everyone can "experience the experience" before they step foot into the hotel. Jovan & Bill Millico Scottsdale, Arizona

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: melindajirwin
Reviews.Content: If you are travelling with you dog this is the best hotel ever! We stayed in a luxury suite that had a living room and large bathroom with 2 person jacuzzi tub and walk in glass shower. Bedroom was large too, and had sofa, desk and flat screen TV with DVD. Staff was extremely accomodating, and spa treatments were also great. Only problem was pool is not very big and you couldn't have fit another person out there Saturday afternoon. There is a very nice neighborhood just to the west Highland Park that is wonderful for walking your dogs in the morning. We took our two large dogs rather than finding a dog sitter for one night. The staff was wonderful, except for the snotty concierge that was working the night we went to ask directions to the nearest dog park. Someone even went out and bought more dog bowls because they ran out for us. Location is great for shopping and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Interior in central (but dull) location with easy highway access”
Reviews.Author: badgerak
Reviews.Content: Doesn't look like much from the outside, but they've done a great job with renovating the interior--pool and lobby were particularly nice. Rooms are fine too. Lobby features an a.m. self-serve coffee bar and evenings a wine and (delicious) sangria happy hour. Seemed to be pet-friendly as there was a sort of doggy happy hour going on too. This is right off 75 and at SMU, so convenient for moving around the city. There's a place across the street, Mockingbird Station, which has a cafe and a group of chain stores. Short drive from Greenville Avenue, where we had breakfast one day. We got a great $89 online rate from hotels.com, but as others have said, it's mandatory $20 valet, so be prepared for that. Also, wireless isn't included. There's a day rate of $10--or $15 for the "fastest" connection. Overall we had a great experience here,but next time in Dallas we might plant ourselves in a neighborhood that has more going on with walkable, unique shops and restaurants, like Uptown. At this place, unless you're centered at the hotel, you'll have to get in your car to find those.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: SeattleDoc2010
Reviews.Content: This is a renovated hotel, and the exterior looks it. But once inside, it was quite nice. There was a great smell in the lobby and the appearance was modern/trendy. I was upgraded to a slightly bigger room on arrival, and found the room to have great ambient sounds playing, with the bed reading light focused on the remote control. It looked hip and cool! To get from the door to the sitting area/desk required negotiating the very small ~1 foot space between the bed and the tv stand. The bathroom was clean, nice. my only complaint would be the old shower head. Come on in this day and age? Rain showers please! I went for a run in their very nice gym, and appreciated their free headphones. Cleaned up and went for dinner. Upon my return at 10 pm, I realized I needed toothpaste. I attempted to call the front desk, but my phone didn't work. I called them on my cell. They were apologetic and gracious. they offered to send someone up right away to fix it. But as I didn't really need my phone for the night, I said fix it tomorrow. 10:30 rolls around and I attempt to turn on my tv. That doesn't work either. Hmm. I called again (on my cell) and again they offered to send someone up right away. I said no. I am going to go to sleep. The next day after work, everything worked fine. If not for the failure of the electronics, I would have loved this hotel. I do think it is a bit pricey at full price for what you get. Would I stay here again for work? Sure. If I am paying? not at that price. Parking is valet only. $20/night I believe. Internet is free if you are a member of their Kimpton In Touch program (rewards program).

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Austin, Texas (We're full...so come visit, then leave)
Reviews.Title: “I booked the hotel at a half off rate of...”
Reviews.Author: ap3266
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel at a half off rate of $95. We arrived at the hotel and found there is valet only parking at $20 per day. Check in was nice, but they have this weird quasi-techno music playing in the lobby all the time. Our room was ready as promised. What they didn't tell us was the $100 hold on our credit card for incidentals. Although I guess it is expected, that seems a little steep. The room was fairly standard; comfy bed, chair, desk, LCD tv, minibar (avoid the minibar....$5 for peanut M&M's!). The bathroom was very nice. I would discover later the water pressure could have been better in the shower...but the amenities were nice. The hotel bar and restaraunt are interesting. The restaraunt is featured on an Oxygen Network show and the prices are no kidding. Entrees were about $30-40. Not to mention the clientele appeared to be a little snooty. We chose to eat across the street at a great Irish pub. Overnight, the room noise was quiet. Housekeeping did get an early start in the morning and that was a little loud but not too bad. All in all, it was a great hotel. However, I would definately shop around and/or call the hotel directly to find the absolute best rate.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: pickybiz
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Great lobby, we were greeted with Arnold Palmers in the reception area and a live goldfish in our room. Front desk staff was very accomodating in changing our room because we did not like the location. Room was roomy and stylish. Nice linens and bath amenities. Great location (outdoor shopping mall and drugstore within a block or two). We had a great time in the pool. Best value for a trendy, yet family friendly, place. The two things they could improve on: valet parking fee (no option but that) and more variety/resonable prices in the children's menu.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Rooms and Lobby”
Reviews.Author: mlizBoston
Reviews.Content: Visiting as one of a group of 4 friends celebrating a 50th birthday. Nice location (not business/financial district of Dallas). Shopping nearby. Hotel features very good contemporary design elements. Feels like a place with a lot of energy but not frenetic. Nice bar area. Attentive service throughout. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Palomar Service Cannot Be Beat”
Reviews.Author: donnaaries
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Palomar for my wedding weekend and also booked my wedding guest block there. Every single employee I interacted with along the process was helpful and friendly. The meeting coordinator Kristen Sudela answered my multiple emails about wedding guest blocks and helped me coordinate the logistics for out of town guest bags (and even out of town doggie gift bags). The Palomar even stepped up to ask about the itinerary for my guests so the concierge would be in the loop about the wedding shuttle bus, etc. I felt that The Palomar went above and beyond their duties as a hotel to make me feel completely at ease about my guests staying there. There were 4 other wedding blocks staying at The Palomar that weekend but you certainly couldn't tell any signs of chaos! We stayed in the Presidential Suite for the weekend, which is a great treat with the huge living/dining area and 3 separate bathrooms. We even received a bottle of champagne and fresh strawberries upon returning to the hotel room after our wedding reception, great ;) We heard nothing but positive comments about The Palomar from our guests, who took advantage of everything from the evening wine reception, to the complimentary Lexus SUV transportation, to the pet friendly policies (we had several guests bring their dogs). I am so glad we chose The Palomar for this occasion. I knew from the get go that this would be one wedding vendor I didn't have to worry about at all, and I was right.

Reviews.Title: “Very Lavish and Trendy Boutique Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mjr6719
Reviews.Content: Very Lavish and Trendy Boutique Hotel. When we arrived at the Hotel Palomar, I was very impressed with the service of the valetâ€™s and doormen. When my partner and I entered the hotel we were greeted with a wine reception and offered a glass of Red or White wines. To find out that this was done every day between the hours of 5 and 6 pm. â€œI travel a lot and none of the hotels I stay at offer this serviceâ€�. I found out that this chain of boutique hotels called â€œKIMPTONâ€� offered it to all guest in all of their hotels across the country. Now thatâ€™s service!!! When I finally made it to the check in counter, we met Allison & Tim, two of the friendliest people I have met in any of the hotels I have visited. They both took the time to explain what the hotel had to offer and even upgraded me to a very beautiful room. I believe it was a Luxury King Room overlooking the Infinity Pool. WOW! After we settled into our room we decided to venture around the hotel. Wine hour had just ended and Tim asked us if we would like another glass of wine. How could I pass that up! Service with a smile! The lobby was just amazing; their restaurant Central 214 was very sleek and incredible food. I applaud the chef for her NAUGHTY Cuisine, to find out Chef Blythe Beck had her own show on the Oxygen Channel. Bravo!!! As we made it thru to the second floor to find the fitness center with all the bells and whistles a workout room should have to find the outdoor pool. More impressive in person with chaise lounge chairs around the pool and 4 cabanas to lie under. I felt very much at home with this Hotel. I joined their Loyalty Program called KIMPTON INTOUCH. I am now and forever a loyal guest of theirs. Thank you Dallas Palomar and a special thank you too their wonderful staff. Monty,

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Treat!”
Reviews.Author: BellsTexas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Dallas Palomar April 30-May 2 for a romantic getaway break. I have always wanted to stay here and was not disappointed. Check-in was SUPER fast, literally less than five minutes. We were sent to the wrong room though, a regular room when we had splurged on a luxury suite. I didn't mind though because I was able to see if the price difference was worth it. My husband went down to get the new room key and was back in less than five minutes. The normal rooms are very nice and I would be happy to pay for one, but if you can swing the price difference the suites DELIVER. We got a huge living room with TV, sofa, huge closet, a REAL plant and their quirky mini-bar. The bedroom and bathroom however were the highlight. The bedroom contained a sofa and chair in the corner, desk, a beautiful bed, and the bathroom was amazing! HUGE soaking tub for two, separate shower, beautiful vanity, etc, etc. We had dinner there at Central 214 and we each got the tasting menu. It was excellent the wine pairings were good. We really enjoyed the food, good service, etc. It was just a good solid restaurant. We also ordered room service both mornings. I wanted eggs Benedict which was not on the room service menu, and they were more than happy to accommodate. The room service breakfast was satisfactory, but it wasn't outstanding and came practically cold. At that price you expect a little more. One thing I would complain about is the traffic noise from the highway. I am a very light sleeper, and the first night I didn't sleep well at all. A simple remedy (which I plan to use if I go back) is to request a fan from the lobby or ask for a room not facing the highway; that would definitely do the trick for me anyway. My husband, however, slept just fine. The things we most enjoyed other than the room and restaurant were the lobby, which is modern and yet very inviting (that can be a fine balance), the free wine hour, complimentary newspapers, coffee, and tea in the morning, and of course the goldfish which we requested. We also asked for a small coffeemaker to be sent up to the room, and it came in less than ten minutes with coffee, creamers, sugar, etc. All in all we loved the hotel. It gives a lot of value and perks for the price, and it was a lot of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury for less. Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Elspeth1014
Reviews.Content: All right, get ready for a gush-fest. I am normally not this enthusiastic, but sometimes a place blows you away, and they deserve the praise. Give credit where credit is due. Hotel Palomar is one of the best hotels in Dallas. The staff is super-friendly, the hotel is in a great location, and the rooms have everything you could possibly want and more. Beds are extra-comfy & the bathrooms are spacious & clean with wonderful toiletries. We stayed in the standard deluxe king room for three nights & couldn't have been happier. Housekeeping did a fabulous job & we had made a huge mess in our room (we tipped well but still it was nice that they went the extra mile). We even ate at the restaurant Central 214 for a special dinner and were thrilled with the service and quality of the food. Kinda pricey but you get what you pay for. Yum! A+++ The only drawback is the valet parking. But we didn't use it so we didn't have to pay the high cost of keeping a car at the hotel. I wish they wouldn't charge for guests to park, however, everything else is amazing. We will definitely stay here again next time we're in town visiting friends. Oh, and maybe our dog will join us, too.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Go”
Reviews.Author: jrouse
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thru Rue la la in December as a Christmas surprise for my husband. He travels quite a bit so we reserved our package in March. It snowed in Dallas in March and all the plane flights were cancelled. I talked to a representative at the hotel and they said they would be glad to reschedule. They never would reschedule nor call us back now, Rue la la will not credit us because they say time has expired!!!! What a waste of money,time and effort..

Reviews.Title: “never book this hotel thru a third party site”
Reviews.Author: bingo56
Reviews.Content: We booked a two night spa package thru the Rue La La website for a March visit. That wasn't easy and took several days of back and forth between the people at RLL and the Palomar. As luck would have it, our flight into Dallas was cancelled so we contacted the hotel and they said no problem, just reschedule at your convenience. After multiple phone calls over multiple days, I can say it is a real problem and each time I try to rebook they say they will call back but never do. I spend about 200 days a year on the road (Diamond HH, Platinum IC, Gold SPG) so I think I have a good idea when I'm getting the run around. So I can't comment on the hotel and most likely never will be able to. So please be careful and if you do book, I would do it only through them.

Reviews.Title: “A Marriott with a smart lobby”
Reviews.Author: Mark_J_G
Reviews.Content: Ona rrival, a film crew was dismantling, which made me think, this must be a cool hotel! The reception area is cool and welcoming. However, after meeting the staff who think they are too cool and then going up to my room, which is basically a Marriott with a funky dressing gown. They do look identical to a Marriott or a Radisson, which is so disappointing. Rooms could be cooler, gym could be bigger, bar could be better and the hotel could be closer to centre of Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in the Lone State”
Reviews.Author: David P
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I recently travelled to Dallas, Texas and we stayed three nights at the Hotel Palomar Dallas (from March 18 to 21, 2010). The Hotel Palomar Dallas is conveniently situated alongside Southern Methodist University (Highway 75 at Mockingbird Lane, approximately 3 miles outside of downtown Dallas) and although an older property, it has been renovated to the typical funky feel that one expects from a Kimpton property. I stayed in a "Luxury King Tall Room". The room itself was just over 400 square feet in size, featuring a King size bed that is 18 iinches longer than a normal King bed, plus a 37 inch LCD television with high definition picture. The room was clean and maid service was excellent. Like other Kimpton hotels, the Hotel Palomar Dallas is dog friendly and we saw several pooches during our three night stay. Wireless high-speed Internet was provided free of charge (you must be a Kimpton In-Touch member to get free Internet -- Kimpton's free loyalty program), as was a daily newspaper at my room door each morning. My only negative comment is that parking costs $20 per day (I am a strong believer in free parking for hotel guests). Concierge's Karena and Jon Paul were very helpful, arranging golf at nearby golf courses, hockey tickets (Dallas Stars vs.Ottawa Senators) and dinner at excellent restaurants (Capital Grille for Texas style steaks on Thursday evening, Toulouse Restaraunt for French food on Friday evening and Texas de Brazil for Brazillian churrascaria on Saturday evening). Car hops were on the ball and everyone seemed to have a smile on their face and a desire to help. Service at the Hotel Palomar Dallas was, simply put, second to none. And how can you argue with the free daily 5 to 6 pm wine bar reception in the hotel lobby (featuring good wines, beer and appetizers at no cost to hotel patrons)? Pros: 1. Very clean and high-end property. 2. Good location. 3. Excellent service. 4. Dog friendly. 5. Excellent outdoor pool (with separate hot tub) area. 6. Has spa and fitness center. 7. Free daily wine bar. 8. LCD televisions in rooms with high definition picture. Cons: 1. Parking is $20 per day. Overall, I rate my experience at the Hotel Palomar Dallas as excellent -- a 9 out of 10. I highly recommend this hotel to othr travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous meeting space and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: jlh1775
