Reviews.Content: I was not lucky enough to stay in the hotel overnight, but I did have the pleasure of hosting a meeting in the Opus meeting room at the Palomar Dallas. What a lovely space in a quiet hallway... I'm not sure when the Palomar Dallas opened, but the meeting space looks and feels as if the finishing touches were just placed. Kudos to Eric, our banquet/conference attendant who took such great care of us - anticipating our needs, and meeting the last-minute request for a whiteboard. Having traveled for business as a conference host/presenter for years, I certainly do not take for granted my positive experiences on the road. Palomar Dallas scores highly for a trouble and worry-free business conference experience. Great job!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: RyP1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel with the most amazing pool! Lot's to do downstairs including "happy hour" in the lounge with complimentary wine of the month and Wii! Walk across the street for shopping and a few restaurants. The design in the building and furniture is fantastic~

Reviews.Title: “funky and fun”
Reviews.Author: bluesky789
Reviews.Content: Seems like an older hotel but with nice touches (marble counters in the bedroom, etc.). Beautiful lobby. Loved the leopard print robes and trendy bedding. Comfortable bed. Nice room arrangement. My view wasnâ€™t great but other rooms had better. I agree with other reviewers that hall noise (people talking & doors closing) was a bit annoying at night. Staff was super helpful and always friendly. I didn't have a pet with me, but these people are SUPER pet friendly. Overall a great place to stay, especially if Fido is traveling with you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Giuliana S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located outside from downtown on the north side of the city. We were terrified by the exterior of the building, but then inside everything changed. Warm welcome, nice smell, nice modern decor, elegant restaurant, beautiful spa. Room are a littlebit larger then other Palomars (ex P.Westwood), soft bed and crisp linen (very appreciated), clean.. just perfect. Still I don't understand why they keep placing that orrible bathtub instead of a modern shower which in my opinion will be much cooler..?!? Don't know if I will ever be back to Dallas, but in that case I will sure know where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “MUST STAY for travelers with pets!”
Reviews.Author: ostatekitty
Reviews.Content: we really enjoyed our stay at the hotel palomar. we brought our chocolate lab, kelso with us because the hotel advertised as being extremely pet friendly. (one recommendation - they never got my pet registration form. if you don't get a confirmation, contact the hotel.) usually "pet friendly" hotels don't allow larger dogs or charge a deposit - the palomar did not have a size restriction and they do not charge a pet deposit. there is a chalkboard in the entry with biscuits and water bowls and also the names of all the pets staying in the hotel, which is very cute. we stayed in a suite with a connected double delux room. the rooms were nice, the beds were very comfortable, and the suite bathroom was huge. modest travelers might want to take note: the bathroom is big enough for multiple people to get ready, but the toilet is not enclosed, so if you want to brush your teeth while your husband uses the toilet, he will not have any privacy. our dog seemed to enjoy having plenty of room to sprawl out in our bathroom, however, since privacy and personal space are not in his vocabulary! the hotel palomar has a wine hour every evening from 5 to 6 when hotel guests can go down and enjoy a glass of wine. it was certainly a nice perk! we did not get to use the pool, but it is heated for year round use and very beautiful. all in all, we had a great stay and were thrilled that such an upscale, contemporary hotel was so accomodating of travelers with dogs. i wish more hotels would follow suit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection from Arrival to Departure”
Reviews.Author: traveling_lct
Reviews.Content: The Staff at the Palomar - Dallas will take care of you from the moment you arrive until the moment you depart. There were five of us in all, two adults and three children. The kids had a special package for their room that included games, art supplies, and a disposable camera among other things all for their taking home. They also had an in room movie and popcorn. I think they were most delighted by the fish that stayed the night in their room with them. Our 12 year old said, "the linens were fabulous, the hotel staff was friendly, room service breakfast was yummy, and the hotel was extremely enjoyable." Pretty impressive if a place makes a constantly grumpy 12 year old smile that illusive smile parents are always seeking. Mom and Dad, on the other hand, were very happy with our own adjoining room with a nice spa tub. We enjoyed the hot tub and heated pool, and parking was included in our room packages. At every turn our visit was pleasant. Everyone remembered us even when we returned later in the day after check out because we had forgotten something. We will return as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Experience”
Reviews.Author: emmochka
Reviews.Content: We used the Hotel Palomar to host our wedding party, as well as the venue for our rehearsal dinner and dessert & dancing party. The dinner and party went wonderfully, but the actual hotel experience was only okay. Not the best service and the rooms are small.

Reviews.Title: “Modern amenities and decor”
Reviews.Author: jerseymainie
Reviews.Content: Palomar is a very chic hotel with a modern vibe and great service. The hotel restaurant has a great bar in the evening, and the breakfasts were very fast out and tasty (especially for a business person on the go). The pool area was relaxing and disguised the fact that you were in a cement patio in a city. Great ambiance, cool vibe, gorgeous rooms. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for those in search of reasonably priced luxury.”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey835
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property dozens of times and would highly recommend it to others. The rooms are modern, spacious, and always clean. The staff is helpful and very friendly. The only downside is their overpriced mandatory valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “A few misses”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl75
Reviews.Content: Greeted warmly upon checkin, but several misses throughout the stay left us feeling frustrated. The morning paper that was requested never arrived each day, went out and bought one when they told us they were out. Key cards stopped working after one day (frustrating after you've waited once for the elevators!) The pool area is smallish, and loses the sun in the early afternoon due to tall buildings around it (then water was too cool to swim in) , and the pool is shared with residences next door, so cabanas were blocked off for a private party when we were there. Other seating around the pool do not have umbrellas, and since you are surrounded by concrete, you'd better be a die-hard sun-worshipper when the sun is out. Room was small but nice with a view of Public Storage. Fresh fruit awaiting us in the room was great. Was told by email and at front desk with a coupon I could receive a discount on spa servce and free class at exhale spa next door. Asked about how I could reserve a class, was told to just show up. Arranged my schedule for the class, and was turned away, wording for the promotion should have been "free class WITH discount on spa service". No one was at all concerned for the inconvenience. Valet's were great and the restaurant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better”
Reviews.Author: Conferencegophers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Palomar last month and had a fabulous time. In addition to this being a spectacular property, the service was remarkable. Every where I turned I was greeted with exceptional service which is a delight in this day and age. The hotel operates on luxury without the luxury rate. The restaurant was fabulous and the menu was not only scrumptious but very creative. I also had a spa visit and found myself not wanting that to end. From the front desk to the valet, we were thoroughly pleased with our visit and can't wait to go back. When you are the Hotel Palomar you are able to truly relax in luxury.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: PghBarb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Palomar on a recent business trip, having chosen it based on Trip Advisor reviews. Your good reviews did not disppoint. The hotel was gorgeous - a perfect mix of modern and warmth - sophisticated without being stuffy. Yes, the room wasn't large, but was perfect for me as a business traveler. The staff was very accomodating to some special requests we had. Had breakfast in the restaurant and it was an experience in and of itself - I've never seen hot tea presented in such a beautiful way - sometimes it's the little things that make the most impact! A little disappointed that Trader Vic's wasn't open on a Monday night, but that's not the hotel's fault. Would definitely stay there again if my travels take me back to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Not Great”
Reviews.Author: jrshoe
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights here for my anniversary. We were very excited about staying here because it is the #1 hotel in Dallas on Tripadvisor. We did really enjoy the hotel, and the staff were excellent. I asked them to light candles in our room for when we returned from dinner and they left a bottle of champagne and a plate of strawberries for us compliments of the staff. It was very nice of them. They also have a complimentary beverage hour every afternoon from 5-6 with wine and sangria. The sangria was very good. I do wish that there another option for parking other than valet parking that is charged $20 per day. On top of the charge, I really didn't want to feel obligated to give the parking steward a tip every time we left or arrived. You could end up spending as much on parking as for the room itself. On to the room. It was a very nice room with great bedding and stylish decor. The bed was not the most comfortable hotel bed we have ever slept on, but it was just fine. The building itself is pretty old (early 1950s) so the layout was a little different and that also caused the actual bedroom space to be a little small. There is a very large entry way at the door to the room which has a half wall separating it from the rest of the bedroom. So instead of opening the door and stepping into a large, open bedroom, there is a good bit of seemingly wasted space. The bathroom was nice and large. However, at a hotel of this level we are used to a bathroom with a separate shower and soaking tub instead of a rather standard shower/tub combo. It just didn't seem to come up with the l'occitane bath products that were supplied. We had a very good time at the Hotel Palomar and enjoyed it very much for our anniversary celebration. But it was good, not really great. It did not stand out nearly as much as some other hotels we have stayed at in Dallas (such as the Zaza or Omni).

Reviews.Title: “You will LOVE Hotel Palomar.....”
Reviews.Author: Judy_scott_2004
Reviews.Content: as much as we do! You are guaranteed happiness and relaxation which is proven by our visit for three days, July 15th, 16th, and 17th resulting in a wonderful discovery of inner well-being. Hotel Palomar reminds you of a small new boutique hotel, with you the guest, as their centered focus. We had been celebrating our 26th Wedding Anniversary and our room was 402, overlooking the Mockingbird Station. Hotel Palomar had upgraded us from a King Spa Room to a Luxury Suite with a king bed and a two person Jacuzzi tub, the room was clean, cool, comfortable and beautiful. The overall stay made us feel as if we had been in an oasis, one thing we did not expect due to a major highway outside our windows, but you would never know this. We spent two days at the lovely infinity pool, always a place to sit and relax with your books, magazines, computer (complimentary high-speed internet), sunscreen and drink (great pool bar service). Central 214 is an outstanding restaurant due to the food, setting and staff (Anniversary dinner and next day had lunch). I spent time at the Exhale spa and had a 60 minute facial ("true") which afterwards my face had a healthy glow and a "true transformation". Customer service at Hotel Palomar is one of many reasons we will gladly return because you will feel like a valued guest by their friendly positive actions. Who knew that ALL the Hotel Palomar staff genuine cared about you and your needs. It is staff such as Connie and Anne who make Hotel Palomar indeed a welcoming and inviting environment. Esp. Anne who had sent us strawberries and champagne for our Wedding Anniversary Friday evening. If YOU need a stay vacation with family or a girls night out/weekend or a surprise romantic weekend with your significant other, then Hotel Palomar is the marvelous place to stay, whether you are in your 20's or 60's, ALL will feel at home. Hotel Palomar is indeed cool and has a great vibe setting, but knowone will feel out of place. I can't wait to return with my girlfriends for a weekend! Sincerely, Judy and Jake Mitchell

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Camareno
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Palomar in Dallas for just one night over the fourth of July weekend and had a great time. Upon entering the hotel you are struck by the cool and relaxing, modern vibe of the lobby. Check in was a breeze and the room was very clean and decorated with a simple modern style. The location is not exactly downtown but it's in a very nice area near a lot of great shopping. The best part of the stay was definitely the restaurant. A lot of times, hotel restaurants are really nothing to speak of. But Central 214 was amazing. The food was great. The cocktails were definitely worth a trip. And our server was extremely knowledgeable and went way above and beyond the call of duty. I believe his name was Roy... the restaurant is very lucky to have him. Great experience. I recommend it. The only way you won't be completely satisfied is if you're looking for a view of the skyline. But if the view isn't of the utmost importance to you, don't pass it up.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff seem consfused.”
Reviews.Author: matts5150
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for our 5th anniversary to stay at after a day of shopping in Dallas. One of the main requirements we had was a jacuzzi tub and when we booked the room were told it had a 2 person jacuzzi however after we checked in and got to our room there was only a standard tub. Slightly upset, we called the hotel's front desk and were told, sorry all the rooms with jacuzzi's were booked however they could comp us $20. Thinking this is our anniversary I'm not worried how much it cost, we then went downstairs to talk to her in person to see what our options were, basically all they did was say "Sorry" and acted like we were bothering them. Considering this was planned weeks in advance and it was our anniversary it was very disappointing to say the least. We then decided we'd just find another hotel with a jacuzzi instead of staying there so we left and stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn and got a room with a jacuzzi. Although it didn't have a hotel restaurant, we went out for dinner and drinks instead and still made a good night of it.

Reviews.Title: “Far Superior to Anything Else in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: sassathon
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Dallas. Granted, I live here, but when I someday move away and then have to come back for a visit, Palomar will be my #1 choice. My husband and I stayed here after our wedding party last week and it was spectacular. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms are really stylish with a modern vibe. The highlight of the Palomar, for me, is their rooftop pool (which is shared with those living in the Palomar's condos). Though small, the pool is super relaxing - you instantly forget that you're in the middle of a gigantic city. The location is the other thing Palomar has going for it. It has super easy highway access and is location close to all of the best areas of Dallas. My family and friends also stayed at Palomar and everyone raved about their stay. They enjoyed the free drinks at the hotel happy hour each night (who wouldn't?). The conceirge was also extremely helpful with all of their requests. I can't recommend Palomar highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic anniversary celebration at Palomar Dallas”
Reviews.Author: arikson77
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Zaza in Dallas several times and we always loved it. For our 5th anniversary, I intended to stay there but when I came across Palomar I decided to try it out. We LOVED it. The customer service was amazing and the hotel itself was comfortable, clean, and very well decorated. I was able to arrange ahead of time with the Concierge, Chris, to have him decorate our room for my wife. I brought roses, chocolates, berries, etc, and ahead of our arrival he spread rose petals all over the room, set up a vase with the other roses, set out the chocolates in decorative bowls, and lit candles. He also threw in a bottle of champagne and a bowl of strawberries as a gift from the hotel. It was beautifully done and my wife loved it. We had a king sized bed in a corner room, which was an upgrade that Chris also arranged as a gift for our anniversary. it had a small sitting area, a desk, a bed, dresser, and a very nice TV. It even had a DVD player. The bathroom was nice, including soaps/shampoos by L'Occitane. The bathtub was nothing special, but clean and new as everything in the hotel is. The pool area is VERY nice, complete with shaded areas with couches and ottomans. The pool itself is very small, but nice. When we checked in, we got 25% off coupons for the attached Exhale spa, where we already happened to have appointments the next morning so it worked out very nicely. FYI, the hotel only offers valet parking for which they charge $20/day. We noticed that Mockingbird Station right across the street had a lot of open parking, so something to consider for next time. All-in-all, we were extremely impressed with this hotel. The outside is nothing special to look at, but inside is a whole different story. This along with excellent service and amenities make us definitely want to go back. P.S. The best part - I won this hotel by bidding on Priceline under $100, and we were still treated like honored guests!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at the Palomar!”
Reviews.Author: Peanscarrots
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of the Kimpton Birthday rate and spent two nights here on a mini vacation over Memorial Day. Loved the location of the hotel--really central to food, shopping etc as it is across from Mockingbird station and just a couple of exits away from Northpark Mall. Also really close to all the restaurants on Greenville and Henderson. The hotel itself is lovely--very modern with great fresh flowers and interesting plants for decor. Our King deluxe room was roomy for the two of us, great bed with a huge flatscreen tv. There was a small desk and a chair with an ottoman as well. The bathroom was nice--good water pressure in the shower and we loved the L'Ocittane products! Our room view was nothing to write home about--we could see across to Mockingbird Station but the downwards view was of the roof of the restaurant I think. Service wise: everyone was efficient, from the front desk to the valet to housekeeping. We were able to participate in the wine hour one evening and had some great Sangria and watched a Wii tennis game in the lobby. As a Kimpton member, we got some fruit and water to snack on upon arrival and it was nice to have some new bottles of water during the turndown service each night. We had drinks at the bar of Central 214 which was ok. There was a wedding there that night so the wedding party had migrated to the bar and were pretty rowdy. Our friends got the $1 breakfast rate with their room and they had the option of one pastry, fruit and a beverage in the mornings. Otherwise we ate elsewhere in Dallas--there are too many good places to pass up! We took a complimentary core fusion class at the Exhale Spa and it was one of the hardest classes I've ever done! It was awesome but I was so sore the next day! The complimentary class was a really good perk to staying at the hotel. The fitness room was small but well equipped (tvs on all machines with headphones provided). When we weren't out gallivanting in Dallas, we spent time at the pool which is lovely. Granted it's only 4ft but it's fun anyways. The water was a bit cool in late May so we took a quick dip then laid in the chairs to dry off in the sun. There were always plenty of chairs and our friends managed to snag a cabana once too. There's a hot tub as well but people and their little kids were in it for the majority of the time. Overall we had a great time and would love to come back (if there's a special rate again!) Cons: $14.99 pay per view movies Kids everywhere Valet parking only Pros: Modern, clean and updated Wine hour at 5pm Little extras like lemon water at the pool Housekeeping will bend over backwards to get you anything Pet friendly Complimentary Core Fusion/Yoga class

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mmhesq
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a wedding group rate which was a steal! The hotel is beautiful, modern, clean and has very friendly staff. The evening wine reception was great and so was our little goldfish roommate. The bed and linens were so comfortable. We will be staying here anytime we visit Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palomar Dallas is Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: DeltaBrent
Reviews.Content: This was my first Kimpton Hotels experience and I am quite impressed. The hotel exemplifies modern sophistication - a sheik hotel "living room," warm decor of hard wood flooring throughout and to hallways with natural lite, and stylish comfortable rooms with upscale amenities. The service I received was like none other. The valet, concierge, and front desk staff were genuinely hospitable and hip. In my room I received a personal greeting card from the concierge along with stationary pre-printed with my name - an impressive personal touch The gym is very nice and includes fitness machines with TV and headphones are provided with sanitary ear protection. In the hotel "living room," I received a nice glass of wine upon arrival and a quality cup of coffee the next morning. Breakfast in the restaurant was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: BoysInNY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Palomar for a business meeting, and I was there for a few days. I've been to Dallas many times, and so far this is one of the best hotels in the area. The location is great! I took a taxi from DFW airport (which cost about $60 with tip). It is located right across the street from Mockingbird Station, which has a DART stop, stores and restaurants. Greenville is just a short taxi ride away. If you're driving to the hotel, it is right off of the Central Expressway at the Mockingbird Exit. It can be tricky to cross Mockingbird on foot, so be careful! The hotel staff is extremely friendly, from the doormen holding the front door open for you to the front desk staff quickly explaining to you the amenities of the hotel. This hotel used to be an older hotel (an old Hilton I believe), but it was remodeled well and looks contemporary. The rooms are decent size. The pillows are a bit soft, so I had a few restless nights when I was trying to sleep. The bathroom has L'Occitane toiletries, which I love! I took a few extra bottles home with me. There is also a zebra striped bathrobe that you can use after the shower, which is pretty funky. Oh, and there is complimentary internet and wi-fi service in the room. Every afternoon from 5:00PM-6:00PM, there is a complimentary wine happy hour in the lobby, which always got the evening off to the right start. Even the server remembered what wine I was drinking the night before. I was very impressed! I also used the gym to workout in the mornings. The gym doesn't have a huge variety of equipment, but there are good options. There were about 5 treadmills, 2 elliptical machines, 1 stationary bike, free weights, and a leg machine. There were plenty of towels and water in the room as well. When we checked in, I was giving a complimentary coupon to try out a Core Fusion class at the spa in the morning. I thought I would try it out with a few friends of mine, and it was worth it! Albeit my body was sore for two days because I had never done this type of class before, this class was very intense. The instructor was wonderful! She had a very calm and soothing voice that made you work hard, and she also offered alternate exercises if the exercise was too extreme for someone. It was a very rewarding class, and I recommend that you experience it at least once! We ate at Trader Joe's, just outside the hotel but on the property, and the food was decent. I recommend Margarita Ranch across the street at Mockingbird Station for good Tex-Mex food. The beef fajitas and white queso were phenomenal! It was too cold to swim in the pool, but I did visit the pool area. It was a very comfortable atmosphere and had a lot of chairs. Overall, my experience at the hotel was great. I was here for three days and rarely left the hotel. There was enough to do to keep me busy when I was bored. I would definitely stay here again, and maybe next time, I'll take the option of having a roommate - a pet goldfish!

Reviews.Title: “Chic , comfortable, fun.”
Reviews.Author: EmilyKimberly
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Kimpton Hotels before, but this was my first time at Hotel Palomar Dallas. I loved it! Great location, cool looking rooms, loved the ipod alarm clock and fun robes, awesome restaurant / bar, and excellent customer service from genuinely happy employees. I love how pet friendly it is -- not only do they allow pets, they welcome them! The front desk manager even had a little chihuahua hanging out at the hotel all day. Every meal I had at Central 214 was absolutely delicious. I'm still thinking about the brie and champagne bisque I ate on Valentines day, and I'm trying to find my way back to Dallas soon so I can have more! The restaurant also has a great bar with tasty specialty cocktails. It's a perfect place to meet clients, but I can also have a romantic dinner or just hang out with family in the restaurant lounge. I was really impressed and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern hotel. Fantastically fanantic guest service.”
Reviews.Author: prepdallas
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had an in-town "staycation" weekend at Hotel Palomar. It was one of the best hotel experiences of my adult life. The rooms are hip and modern, without being uncomfortable (unlike some hotels that achieve "hip" at the expense of comfort). The restaurant, Central 214, was phenomenal. (I'm still full.) Most of all, I loved Hotel Palomar's sense of humor and playfulness. They don't take themselves too seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated hotel without snootiness”
Reviews.Author: texleftee
Reviews.Content: My husband took care of our 10-month-old daughter so I could spend the night in Dallas and Hotel Palomar was just what the doctor ordered. The kind gentleman at the front desk upgraded my room at no charge so I had a king size bed and a HUGE jetted tub at a HotWire price. Ate at the hotel restaurant, 214, where I was treated like royalty. If you go, you must order their mac and cheese. The hotel is beautiful and elegant with attentive service. Would stay there again this weekend if I could! I will say the spa was not the greatest - and there are plenty of other spas in Dallas to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Palomar is THE BEST place to stay in Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: story360
Reviews.Content: My business partner and I recently took a week-long trip to Dallas for work and stayed at the Hotel Palomar. As big fans of Kimpton Hotels, we try staying in one any chance we get. The Hotel Palomar, like all the other Kimptons we've stayed in, was perfect in every way! From the staff (professional, fun and friendly) to the rooms (luxuriously appointed, spotlessly clean and extremely comfortable) to its fashionable restaurant Central 214 (some of the best food we've ever had)... the hotel offered us a fantastic stay. As frequent travelers to Dallas we have stayed at the W and the Hotel ZaZa -- both super trendy and Ã¼ber pricey. The Hotel Palomar had all the upscale feel of these hotels without all the attitude and cost. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Dallas -- for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: johnMiami_Florida
Reviews.Content: i hosted a board meeting at this property and am very glad i did! they exceeded all expectations in the advance planning/booking for my group, the front desk, concierge, banquet services, fabulous restaurant, etc.... beautiful appointed hotel, very chic! lots of shopping and dining also within in walking distance to the property and a short cab ride away from upscale mall shopping too. great option when traveling to Dallas for either business or pleasure!! i really enjoyed my stay as did my entire group.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JaTexan2004
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Hotel Palomar Dallas. The staff was very friendly and professional, and my room was amazing (I stayed in the Luxury Suite). The hotel really does try to cater to your every need, without being overly pushy. My only complaint was that the room smelled a little musty, like it needed to be aired out a bit, but that could of only been partial to my room. Also, don't bother eating dinner at Central 214, the food is not very impressive for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting - a little pricey but nice”
Reviews.Author: sbccc
Reviews.Content: This is an interesting spot. You are right next to Central Expressway so it's convenient. The hotel has all the fancy touches with valets and bellmen that are actually quite good. The rooms are nice and well appointed - standard sized rooms. The restaurant is pretty trendy and pricey - as is the bar. We stayed here on business. It was nice. The Radisson next door was about one third cheaper (129 vs 189). The Palomar is basically a dressed up Radisson - nicer appointments and staff etc. If you want that then you will get your money's worth. If you just want a room go next door. Hooters had their Christmas party there while we were there - that was interesting. I don't expect the the hotel bar is that lively most nights.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice modern accomodation”
Reviews.Author: PNTRAVEL2007
Reviews.Content: It is overall a very nice hotel, with a great location just of Hwy 75 and across from a modern small shopping center and cinema complex. The restaurant is also very nice. Great lobby. Very comfortable beds, wonderful flatscreen HDTV, modern decor. Two negatives: very dirty stained shower curtain and also it is sort of annoying to have only valet option for parking; in Dallas one may end up using their car quite a bit. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SSemone
Reviews.Content: I can tell you first off that the food here is Excellent. I had a goat cheese pizza at the bar with drinks and for room service I had lobster bisque and Caesar salad-- both meals were wonderful. I don't know if it is a good thing or a bad thing that I am mentioning the food first. The hotel itself was nice. Rooms were comfortable and clean. Location is great. We had a suite and it was spacious with a large bathroom and separate area with couch and TV. The decor is modern.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ianp1
Reviews.Content: I loved almost everything about the Palomar. The staff are so friendly and helpful (especially the valet parkers). The design is great and the rooms very comfortable and clean. The restaurant is cool and the food good. The location is excellentâ€”it's only a short taxi drive away, for instance, from the North Park Mall (which is one of the best things in Dallas). The hotel's adjoining day spa is also fantastic. I had one of the best massages ever there. In fact, I only had one slightly annoying experience during my stay, when I sat down at a table near the bar just after my arrival, dying of hunger. It was absolutely impossible to get the attention of a waiter for about 10 minutes... which was really annoying. They apparently thought I was just sitting there waiting for someone. When they realised I actually wanted to eat, they were really charming and ended up offering me the drink and snack on the house. I thought that very gracious. The only other gripe I'd have about the hotel would be the gym... which is a little small and under-equipped. Other than that, the Palomar was brilliant. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful,friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TimTheTraveler
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Palomar for his birthday and to watch the Olympic Opening Ceremony with friends. This hotel has so much style. Everywhere you look,it is just beautiful. The room was big and so well appointed. The staff was so nice and the most helpful we've ever encountered. Thank you for keeping that ice coming,lol. They even give you a companion goldfish ,if you like. When our fish,Bubbles, passed away,they had Bubbles II in the room in five minutes. If you want a great stay in fantastic hotel,this is the place! I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised! Loved it! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: BlondieOklahomaCity
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a weekend in Dallas for my birthday. He booked the Hotel Palomar after getting a recommendation from a friend. We were thrilled by the location of the hotel. A few minutes from North Park Mall and a few minutes from Uptown/West Village. A starbucks and little shopping area is right across the street, and several restaurants on the hotel property (including Trader Vic's). The hotel is trendy but not overly so. Very tastefully decorated. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and not stuffy at all. They gave us 25% off our room rate if I would juggle a hackey sack (spelling?) which I had never done before! Pretty strange I know, but it was actually fun, so I did it! I was terrible, but I will do anything to save a buck! :) So we got our $219 room rate down to $169. Our room was quite large with an awesome jacuzzi bathtub (so huge both my 6'3'' husband and I could fit in it together! ). The bed was extrememly comfortable and extra long since it was a California King. We had drinks at the hotel bar one night and it was very nice. Not overly busy, but a nice place to talk. Great Chocolate martinis! My husband booked us a couples massage at the hotel spa and it was amazing. The spa itself is quite small with not much but a locker room and steamroom, but the service was incredible! Best massages we have ever had. Overall our experience at the Palomar was top notch. Some extras I forgot to mention about the hotel are the free glasses of wine in the lobby of an evening, and the free bottles of water in the room each day and also water available for joggers in an ice bucket in the lobby. Overall I give the Palomar an A+ for our stay. It is our new favorite Dallas hotel. Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay”
Reviews.Author: monkeyjarhead
Reviews.Content: Just got home from Dallas and stayed one night at the Palomar. Had heard good things from a friend and we were traveling for a family meeting with our 18 month old. We checked in about 11pm to stellar staff and stellar service. They actually had put someone in our room but upgraded us to another room which was great. We needed a crib which came immediately. The rooms are very clean and swank. Great bedding which we are pillow top and high thread count fans. Everything was perfect. The hotel is of contemporary design and as I said before hip. I have stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Dallas and would either stay here(Palomar) or the Mansion at Turtle Creek. However, you could stay at the palomar 3 nights for the cost of 1 at the Mansion or Ritz. I highly reccomend Hotel Palomar and their staff and training is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PlanoTripper
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful hotel: attentive staff, well-designed and decorated room, nice lobby and fun happy hour. This resurrected Dallas landmark lives up to its promise.

Reviews.Title: “The Palomar is my favorite hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: ddyjr
Reviews.Content: I heard about the Palomar before it opened. I was in Dallas in 2007 for a charity event so I booked a room with the intention of visiting the Trader Vics' on the property. While enjoying the free Wine Hour in the lobby, I learned about the Central214 restaurant and never went anywhere else. In 2008 when the charity event came around again, I booked a room for me and my sweetheart. We enjoyed ourselves tremendously! It was a very classy and comfortable experience. The staff treated us like expected special guests. Our room was quiet and seemingly luxurious. I remember asking if we were in a special type of room and was assured that it was their standard. We enjoyed the Wine Hour again. GREAT LOBBY! Very compfy, with a fireplace. Made it to Trader Vics,and relaxed for the evening. We were intrigued by the pool and went down to the hot tub later in the evening. Soft music, nice hot tub, and a super oasis-like environment. We cannot wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “We love the Palomar!!”
Reviews.Author: Greg00
Reviews.Content: I didn't get the name of the employee, but, I asked the front desk if they sold any rolaids for my daughter. They were out, and a tall gentleman said "I can go across the street and buy them for you, what is your room number?" I could not believe it. A few minutes later, he knocked on our door with the rolaids he purchased with his own money. To make this story even better, he remembered me in the lobby a few days later and asked how my daughter was doing. What class! This hotel has some of the best trained staff, and I travel all over the world. The rooms are modern and clean, and room service dims the lights and angles the spot lights on the candies they leave on the beds at night. Very refreshing to come back to after a hot day in Dallas! I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and look forward to our next stay. Thanks Palomar!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great hip hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SMUMOM
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Palomar. WOW! After a delayed flight to Dallas, my son and I arrived at the hotel Sunday, near midnight....exhausted. We were greeted by a friendly staff (even at that late hour) and were happy to find our room inviting and extremely comfortable! The room was a nice size with a great color scheme and I loved all the extra touches.... the bottled water w/ drinking glass' next to each bed, the animal print robes, the leopard print pajamas and socks hanging in the closet, and the BEST.....the L'occitane bath/body products! Being a native Dallasite, I remember when the hotel was the Hilton and can appreciate what a quality renovation and design job Kimpton has done. The hotel is beautiful and fun and funky! The bar was very nice w/ great martinis and our breakfast at 214 was WONDERFUL! (I recommend the Brioche French toast with Strawberry coulis) The hotel staff was friendly, professional, and eager to make my stay a pleasant one. I will be returning to Dallas next month and will definently stay at the Palomar again!

Reviews.Title: “Smooth”
Reviews.Author: Skyyj
Reviews.Content: I'm in Dallas at least once a month and I always and I mean always love The Palomr. The people, the space, the location are all fabulous for anyone doing business in "D". My clients, love meeting me there. I've had times, when I never left the hotel. Breakfast, lunch and dinner meetings...All at The Palomar. Kimpton has the touch. Lje

Reviews.Title: “Not all Kimptons are created equal - Palomar Dallas sets the bar HIGH!”
Reviews.Author: CrozMo
Reviews.Content: I've had the pleasure of staying at this property as a meeting manager as well as for personal getaways and am spoiled by The Palomar in Dallas. My husband and I just returned from NYC where we stayed in 2 other Kimpton properties. They were both nice and clean but nothing compares to the unparalleled service experienced at the Dallas property. They just do it right! Finally, a hotel that "gets it." They have the blessing of the BEST valet (quick, courteous, and handsome), BEST front office staff (exceeded expectations on all stays there), BEST sales staff (truly the best of the best) and BEST banquets department (a meeting planners DREAM, trust me!). Guest rooms are surprisingly big, perfect turn down service, friendly and meticulous housekeeping staff and quick room service that has always been right the first time. It's said that there's no place like home and I completely agree BUT if I'm going to lay my head anyplace else, Palomar Dallas is my pick for amazing service and sweet dreams in one of their super comfy beds. Other properties could learn a lot from this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Noise and Lack of Privacy”
Reviews.Author: belleslady
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a relative, who happened to be sick and was essentially bed-ridden for all three nights. Unfortunately, the Palomar did not provide any peace or quiet. You can hear doors slamming all day and night as guests exited their rooms. And between 7 am and noon forget about it. The maids would engage the deadbolts and allow the doors to slam up against the frame as they went in and out cleaning the rooms. This was like pure torture for anyone let alone someone who wasn't feeling well. In addition, the staff entered our room on a number of occassions after only one knock and no delay. I was actually on the far end of the room, and when I turned around after the knock the staff member had already come in. Instead of leaving immediately, she began to ask me as I stood in my underwear if I needed to restock the minibar- even though there was a do not disturb sign outside! In short, the hotel is nice enough physically for a four star, nothing to write home about, but at that class level you expect the best in both services and amenities. You also need to adore pets, because the hotel is the most open I've seen about pets. We were in the elevator at one point with more dogs than humans.

Reviews.Title: “excellent services, very clean room”
Reviews.Author: picturejoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights as a business traveler. The hotel is remodeled two years ago, lobby looks nice, room is very clean, bathroom is roomy. The phone in the room is actually a cordless phone. The hotel also provide you free toothpaste/tooth brush if you forget to pack yours. And last but not least, hotel staffs are very friendly. I wish they have complimentary coffee/tea at your room so you can use it whenever you want, but instead, they offer complimentary coffee/tea at the lobby in the morning only. We didn't get to eat at the 214 restaurant at the hotel, so not sure if the food is good there, and I didn't get to use the swimming pool either.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palomar - great inside and out”
Reviews.Author: Keithcu
Reviews.Content: If your travels bring you to Dallas... well, I'm sorry. But don't despair because the Hotal Palomar will cure what ails you -- even if it's Big D. The service and amenities of this hotel are well documented here. So, I'll focus on life outside the hotel. You may not want to leave, but if you do venture outside the hotel, here are some recommendations. Donuts! Take a beautiful walk across SMU to Snider Plaza where you will find Mustang Donuts. This is homemade daily goodness... The mile walk will help your conscience -- no accounting for taste on the names of SMU's buildings (Ford, Bush, etc.)... Beer! Across the street to Mockingbird Station and sample the dozens of interesting taps at Trinity Hall. Tacos! Hidden on the backside of the Mockingbird Station shopping thing is Urban Tacos. Yum and what a deal. The concierge can give you maps. Heck, the Palomar staff might offer to walk you there. I want some of whatever they're on. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Dallas hotel!”
Reviews.Author: belletx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Dallas for a 1 night stay at the Palomar. The hotel was great. Very clean with stylish, modern decor. The hotel was bright and airy, not depressing like some modern hotels. It was small and very quiet. The pool area was great and the spa was very nice and accomodating. The hotel is very close to North Park Center, Highland Park and Uptown. Great location!! Great price for quality if you don't want to spend $400 on the Ritz or W.

Reviews.Title: “A ray of light in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: weemacs
Reviews.Content: I was in Dallas on business and was put up in this hotel. What a delightful spot with a charming welcome from the forecourt staff all the way to the luggage being delivered to the room. And that was the service that I enjoyed throughout my three day stay. Lovely people and very well looked after. Breakfast was extensive and we had dinner there one night which was up to scratch. You need a car in Dallas. You cannot get anywhere as there are no pavements to talk of. The bar life after work was very good fun and as this hotel hosts conference delegates the evening parties can also be entertaining. Beats the chain hotels hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel butâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: J_and_A_1
Reviews.Content: We really liked the Palomar a lot. The modern dÃ©cor is very nice without being too trendy. The staff is friendly and helpful. The location is central, on the edge of the very beautiful Park Cities area and close to downtown. But the hotel is also right next to a highway and the noise is hard to ignore. We booked a one bedroom suite that had a large entry foyer, living room, separate bedroom, and large white marbled bathroom. There was one step down from the hallway to the living room and bedroom areas and one step up to the bathroom. Each room was good size with a black and pale yellow color scheme and very nice flat screen televisions with some of the clearest pictures we have seen. A bedside iPod docking station is an appreciated addition to the room. The beds were very comfortable. The lighting was nice and allowed us to created mellow mood at night. Of course the best non-standard feature of the room was the gold fish that kept us company throughout our stay! The bathroom was a real standout. With a whirlpool for two, separate shower, and very attractive overall look. The bath products were by Lâ€™Occitane. The rest of the hotel is also very nice with a bright cool looking lobby, and a hip looking restaurant/bar. The hotel gym is nice but very small and does not present much of an opportunity to get a good workout. There is a spa at hotel but we did not check it out. The pool area is very nice by design, but unfortunately it was too cool to swim in. I was told by a guest that stays at this hotel on a regular basis that she thought the hotel kept the temperature low during the week and raised it on the weekends when the pool scene picked up. The air temperature was in the upper seventies during our stay. Our room was in the middle of the hotel so half the rooms where closer to the highway and half farther away. Although we slept well, there is a constant noise level that we think would bother some guests, especially if they are on a vacation. It was also a shame that the owners of the hotel built a residence building to the south of the hotel, blocking a nice view of downtown and taking sunlight away from the pool. The hotel offers a complimentary wine hour every night that is a nice touch you can not find at very many hotels. The Palomar is a beautiful hotel that has the feel and look of a nice boutique style property. If highway noise is not a factor for you, then you should be pretty happy at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “amazing renovation, bad housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: yafman
Reviews.Content: this is a four-star hotel but i had to take it down a notch because of multiple housekeeping-related issues we experienced during our stay. to begin with, when we checked in they radioed housekeeping from the front desk to ensure that our room was ready for check-in. when housekeeping said the room was ready, we were given the green light to go upstairs; however upon arrival the maid was still cleaning the room and this must have caused her to feel rushed because she did not swap out the toiletries for fresh bottles or remove the used roll-on stick from the bathroom floor. secondly, i left behind a gift card that i was supposed to be a birthday present. i realized my error and called the day of checkout but it was nowhere to be found. finally, i received a minibar charge despite the fact that i did not utilize the minibar at all. maybe it's because i was given a minibar key with the room key and there was already a minibar key in the refridgerator but in either case they should be honest about counting the inventory. they were more then happy to credit the bill but for a $250/night suite i should not have to go through all that. housekeeping issues aside, this is a very nice facility and it's amazing to see all the renovations they put into what was a sleazy, run-down eyesore in an otherwise upscale neighborhood. one other precaution i would cite is that you have to utilize their valet service ($20/day) to park in the hotel. there is a residents' lot around the corner but i was informed that i might be towed if i parked there so i had to eat the valet charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business, Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: hppyfeet
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I was in town for business and it was highly recommended by colleagues. I was bit nervous becuase I had my husband and two young kids with me and I wasn't sure if a great business hotel would be a great family hotel. Turns out it was. The room is a bit small, especially when adding a cot and crib but the hotel was accomodating in every way. While the only parking options is valet ($18 a night), the valet staff gaves us tips for dinner and places to explore. (Try the children's museum or Dallas zoo.) The best example of the hospitality was that they washed several pieces of clothing for us after my son got sick on the airplane that day. I asked for a nearby cleaner and they offered to take care of it for us, for no charge. Later that night, we had our clean clothes delivered in a wicker basket. A great touch for a road-weary family. We also enjoyed the nightly turndown service (mints, bottled water and extra towels) and the outdoor heated pool and hot tub. I would absolutely stay here again and the staff earned our loyalty for not making us feel like the odd-family in an upscale place.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with a modern twist”
Reviews.Author: lgelkins
Reviews.Content: It didn't look like much from the outside, but from the moment I pulled up to the Hotel Palomar, I was impressed. The valets and check-in staff were extremely friendly and helpful, as were the room service waiters and housekeeping. The location was perfect for our girls' weekend. About 5 minutes from West Village shopping area, and probably 10 minutes or less to the North Park Mall. Parking at the hotel was $18/night. I booked a standard room with two beds and requested an upper floor with early check in, both of which I received happily. The room (623) was comfortably large, immaculately clean, and overlooked the fabulous pool area, which was preferable to the street view. The modern decor was nicely designed and even the lobby and other public spaces were tres chic. In the room: Two robes are provided for your stay and slipper socks are available for purchase. There is also a mini bar in the room, which is stocked with great (some healthy) snacks and drinks - of course, you pay for what you use. The large flat-screen tv was great. Another appreciated feature was a DVD/CD player, which I used to listen to my music and watch movies we brought. Before I made the reservation, I signed up as a Kimpton member, so I am not sure what was standard treatment and what the hotel provides for their frequent travelers. Whatever the case, I loved the personal touches: personalized stationary, turn-down service with chocolates and bottled water, fresh fruit with a small canvas, paintbrush and paint if you are feeling creative. The business center charges for internet use, but is equipped with some nice iMacs. The guest rooms also have internet access for laptops. Room service was delicious and on time. Exhale spa is attached to the hotel, which was nice because it was cold and rainy when I was there. I had a massage, which was pretty good, but the better thing was the steam room - really relaxing. The spa facilities seemed very clean, modern, and smelled great. Book before you go because they were busy. I would definitely stay again and would try their other locations based on the good experience I had in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palomar is a Must Stay!”
Reviews.Author: arkansastiger
Reviews.Content: Fabulous property - most everything was wonderful about the hotel. The best part was service - we were very impressed with the quality service and friendly staff at the Palomar. The rooms are very nice, though a bit small. The TV's are huge and the beds are as comfortable as I any hotel I have stayed at. The spa attached to the hotel is great. Check it out. The restaurant is okay, however, i mentioned that in my online survey after my stay and got very prompt and sincere followup from the hotel manager and the food and beverage manager. They seem to take the feedback seriously. I am confident you won't regret your stay at the Palomar. They are a wonderful hotel with wonderful people. By the way, our transportation to and from the airport was fabulous. Our driver was Larry Shelton and he can be reached at [-].

Reviews.Title: “ultra hip Palomar”
Reviews.Author: kctraveler99
Reviews.Content: I styayed here with wife on Dec 29, for 2 nights. Paid regular rate of aprox 325/night for a deluxe king. Staff very friendly and helpful. Car valet guy brought car up in quick time. Check in was quick. Luggage was brought to room right away. Wife needed a razor for legs, and it was brought with in 3 minutes of the phone request. Did breakfast room service,, quick and tasty. This was a Hilton back in the late 60's. It was closed and Kimpton totally redid it and it reopened in Sep 2006 as the Palomar. It reminds me of a -W- type of property. They had a nice 1 hour free wine/champagne happy hour in the lobby, along with free coffee in the morning. Small touches,, but those build a repeat visit. Small things but... in room desk area had a --4-- port electrical plug in for computers/phones. etc. Free internet, bioth wired and wirelss. 2 phones (1 handsfree), 2 line telephones. Great LG HDTV/flat panel LCD TV's... Nice radio, and cool reading lamps on bed so wife could sleep while I worked (sorry, we are married)... Another thing.... so many hotels now use compact flour. light bulbs. They put off a stange color, but at the Palomar, true incadesent bulbs, bright enough for reading/working. Lots of dimmers for lighting. Also, nice bathroom shampoo/soaps. Wife did yoga at the Exhale spa.. Free workout equipment access. Overall a great experience and highly recommended. PS The new Trader Vic's restaurant just steps around the corner from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous !”
Reviews.Author: NiallSeton
Reviews.Content: First of all the convienet location made staying there so easy, on and off the highway in seconds, was such a treat, and made it such a breeze to travel around Dallas. The staff was so friendly and went WAY out of thier way to accomodate and be certain I had everything I wanted \ needed. And then the rooms were impeccably clean and so tastefully decorated with such a flair it felt like such a shame to mess it up. Then the next day it was spotless again. Of course the HUGE television didn't hurt. I have travelled all over the world and have stayed at many hotels, the Palomar in Dallas is easily 6 stars, the staff really puts it over the top ! I would highly reccomend staying there, and I have, to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is awesom”
Reviews.Author: girlFriday48
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Palomar several times and it is a wonderful hotel. The rooms are spacious and reasonably priced. The staff at the hotel is unbeatable. They greet you when you drive up, and are always eager to make your stay as comfortable as possible. They always make you feel special and important. My company has held a couple of meetings there and they have always come off flawless. The food is wonderful. I canâ€™t say enough nice things about the hotel. I will go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel EVER!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vickidiep
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Dallas for a convention at the Hyatt, but I heard from a friend that the Hotel Palomar is a MUST stay, so we changed hotels. I am delighted to say that it was nothing short of spectacular. Being from Chicago, it was nice to have such genuine southern hospitality. From the doorman to the housekeeper, everyone was friendly. The hotel was also VERY clean and the interior design...stunning! (You should see all the artwork). Konni (the Concierge) was superb about recommendations for night-life and meals. Too bad we were only there for 3 nights because we certainly wanted to stay much longer. -Vicki (& Allan)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and very pet friendly!”
Reviews.Author: PinkBombshell
Reviews.Content: This has been the third time I have stayed at The Palomar and I couldn't ask for anything more. The staff here is very helpful, always greet you with a smile and take care of any problems you have very quickly. Before Palomar I was staying at Hotel Zaza...I love that place...but I couldn't seem to get my work done with all the nightlife and activity there so I decided to give Palomar a try. The hotel decor is very hip and the bar and room service are great. I have two little dogs that I have taken with me twice and a few of the staff members treat them like their own. They even asked why I didn't bring them the third time. The detox massage at the spa is also wonderful. This place is great for leasure or business.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of potential, but a long way to go”
Reviews.Author: lagniappe34
Reviews.Content: Ok, I am a Dallas native, I had some time off and wanted to get away just by myself. I booked a hotel/spa pkg that included a bunch services (details to follow). I am familiar with this hotel from it's days as the old Hilton and have drinks there quite a bit currently. The Review: The hotel lobby is so stylish, the pool is subdued, but kind of cool. The desk clerk was terribly rude, I was really excited about my stay and she could have cared less. I got to my room and it was just claustrophobically tiny. The bed hit the tv stand. I went back down to try and get a larger room which I was even willing to pay for. Rude Desk Clerk Girl told me I had to go to spa, through which I booked the room to get a room change. I thought this was incredibly poor service. Regardless, I did it. The spa manager could have cared less as well. I went back to the hotel front desk, told Rude Desk Clerk Girl that the spa manager had nothing for me and she told me there was nothing she could do. I asked for her boss, he was incredibly nice and accommodating and upgraded me to a larger room. I must admit the room was still quite small. The decor in the rooms was interesting, modern Kimpton style. The spa experience was terribly average. Dallas has a ton of spa/hotel experiences and this one is just so not up to par with them. The massage therapist didn't listen to what I wanted or my requests. The facialist was just fine. The manicurist/pedicurist tried way to hard to sell stuff to me. The manager of the spa just wasn't a welcoming/inviting person. They really made me feel like a nuisance (which I might have been), but regardless, I was still a guest and should have been treated as such. This is a very stylish hotel, with terribly average services and save for gracious hotel manager (Elliott, i believe his name was), terribly below average staff all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great service except during prime times”
Reviews.Author: TA77002
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Palomar Dallas twice. The hotel is in a good, central location and within easy walking distance to SMU. The hotel underwent a first class refurbishing before opening as the Palomar. Rooms are somewhat masculine in decor (zen like) but comfortable and roomy. My only complaint is that the front desk and valet staff appear to be understaffed during peak time periods (e.g. on Fri/Sat nights), even though the staff seems eagar to please. The valet staff at first forgot to retreive and then "couldn't find" both my and separately my friend's cars. It took each of us almost an hour to finally get our cars out of valet, and that was after notifying the head of valet. Another surprising problem is that I called to place a wake up call at around midnight on a Saturday, and I was unable to reach ANYONE at the hotel (that is, no one picked up when I repeatedly dialed lines to the wake up desk, front desk, valet, concierge, etc...) I even called Kimpton's main number and central reservations tried for 15 minutes to contact the Palomar directly to no avail. When I finally reached someone at the hotel (by then it was well past the time I was ready to go to bed), I was told that everyone was busy, as though it was a common problem at that time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good business trip”
Reviews.Author: hsblendo
Reviews.Content: I went to Dallas for a business trip at the end of October and enjoyed the Hotel Palomar. Wireless internet access was great, the room was comfortable (and the bed was very comfortable!) and I slept well. The property is stylish and I love the Kimpton wine hour (although I didn't get a chance to enjoy it this time around). The location was convenient because we had to be at a few different places around the city. There were minor imperfections (bad water pressure, broken dead bolt) but overall, I was happy with my stay and would definitely recommend the Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palomar”
Reviews.Author: Dallasfan07
Reviews.Content: What a great weekend escape! We decided to just get away from the house for the weekend, but not go to far. So we checked in to the Hotel Palomar and found it to be an urban oasis. The staff are friendly and helpful. The food at both Central 214 and Trader Vics was excellent. Overall it was just what we were looking for as a close weekend get away treat. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Style, elegance and luxury”
Reviews.Author: DRace
Reviews.Content: What a treat. Having grown up Dallas and remember when the Mockingbird Hilton was all the rage, it looked like nothing would ever really be done with the property again. And now someone has taken this wonderful property, updated it and made it a first class luxury hotel. The lobby and rooms are perfectly decorated and compliment the outstanding architecture. The bed is heavenly. The staff could not be nicer and more willing to help. The cocktail reception and coffee bar are a lovely addition to your stay. And the Central 214 should not be missed. While there are a wealth of fine restaurants in Dallas, this was truly one of the best meals with the best service I have had in the city. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel that is a bit distinct”
Reviews.Author: PhyllisMH
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel following the good reviews on tripadvisor and the reasonable rate we got. We were not disappointed. The interior of the hotel is distinct as are the rooms and it was a refreshing change fromt same old same old of the traditional US chain hotel in this price bracket (Marriot, Hilton, etc). Service was generally good although for some reason check in is not until 4 in the afternoon and we were not able to check in until dead on 4 as the hotel was full. The location was pretty good, just off the interstate and in a nice part of town and not too far from downtown, the malls etc. Being English I never like the valet parking only idea. I much prefer the option of parking my own car but that was only a little niggle. The only other niggle was the what we thought general poor quality of the cocktails in the bar considering their price. Overall though a pleasant and good hotel and if I ever happened to be in Dallas again I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best ever”
Reviews.Author: tf403
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel frequently to first class hotels and resorts. Our stay at the Palomar ranks right up there with any Ritz or Four Seasons. The staff is impeccably trained and exceptionally friendly and helpful. They knew our names almost from the moment of arrival. The King Suite was spacious and very well decorated. The bathroom was immaculate and the large jacuzzi was wonderful. Room service arrived within 15 minutes of placing the order and was delicious. The hotel is located just off the SMU campus and is in an area of great restaurants and shopping. We cannot wait to return and to try other hotels in the Kimpton chain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: TripSurvivor
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a king suite for a one night getaway for my wife's birthday. Hotel Palomar definitely exceeded our expectations in every way. Both the public spaces and rooms are well decorated. The staff was very friendly. Our beagle loved their pet friendly policies. We got a very good promotional rate. Only negative is, even on the 8th floor, you still hear Central Expressway. I liked it so much I recommended it to three business associates who went there last week and all raved about it.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Palomar Dallas - a Kimpton Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 5300 E Mockingbird Lane, Dallas, TX 75206
